en: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
zo: A kipat cil-in Pasian in vantung le leitung a piangsak hi.

en: May mercy, peace, and love be multiplied to you.
zo: Note khempeuh tungah hehpihna, le itna thupha tampi tak hong tung tahen.

en: For great is His loving devotion to us, and the faithfulness of the LORD endures forever. Hallelujah!
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh eite a hong itna lian mahmah a, Topa’ thutakna a tawntungin kip ngitnget hi. Topa phat un.

en: The blessing of the LORD brings wealth, and He adds no trouble to it.
zo: Topa’ thupha in mite hausak a, dahna le gimna tawh piakhawm lo hi.

en: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.
zo: Topa Jesuh Khrih hong hehpihna thupha, le Pasian’ hong itna, le Kha Siangtho tawh kikholh theihna, note khempeuh tungah hong tung tahen.

en: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘When any of you brings an offering to the LORD, you may bring as your offering an animal from the herd or from the flock.
zo: “Israel mite tungah gen inla, amaute tungah hih bangin ci in: Note khatpeuh in Topa’ tungah biakna na paipih uh ciangin, ganhing tawh na biakna pen bawnghon panin hitaleh tuuhon panin hitaleh na paipih ding uh hi.

en: He declared to you His covenant, the Ten Commandments, which He commanded you to follow and then wrote on two stone tablets.
zo: Thupiak Sawmte ahi note’ hih dinga hong thupiak ama thuciamna note’ tungah hong gen a, amah in suangpek nih tungah tuate a gelh hi.

en: So the people shouted, and the priests blew the trumpets. And when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, they raised a great shout, and the wall collapsed. The people charged straight into the city, and they captured it.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin mite awng a, peengkulte kitum hi. Mite in peengkul aw a zak phetun nakpitakin awng uh a, kulhpi cimmai-in, mi khempeuh amau mai ciatah tangtakin khuapi sungah pai uh a, khuapi a la uh hi.

en: Reaching into his bag, David took out a stone and slung it, striking the Philistine on the forehead. The stone sank into his forehead, and he fell facedown on the ground.
zo: Tua ciangin David in a khutin a thungip sawkin suangtang khat la a, a kap leh Filistia-pa’ taltang a kha hi. A taltangah a suangtang tum a, leilakah amah maipuk hi.

en: As they were walking along and talking, suddenly a chariot of fire with horses of fire appeared and separated the two of them, and Elijah went up to heaven in a whirlwind.
zo: Tua ciangin amaute a pai kawmkawm a kiho laitakun, mei leeng khat le mei sakolte in amaute nih a khen hi. Tua ciangin vantungah Elijah pingpei-in paito hi.

en: In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, to fulfill the word of the LORD spoken by Jeremiah, the LORD moved the heart of Cyrus king of Persia to issue a proclamation throughout his realm and also to put it in writing:
zo: Persia kumpi Sairas’ uk kum khatna kumin, Jeremiah tungtawnin Topa’ thugen a tun theih nadingin, ama gam sung khempeuhah taangkona khat bawlin lai-in zong a gelh nadingin Persia kumpi Sairas’ lungsimah Topa in a suaksak hi. Amah in hih bangin a hih hi:

en: So we rebuilt the wall until all of it was joined together up to half its height, for the people had a mind to work.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin kulh ka ciang uh a, nasep a kimciang bang kizo hi. Mite in utna lungsim tawh sem uh hi.

en: And the king loved Esther more than all the other women, and she won his grace and favor more than all the other virgins. So he set the royal crown on her head and made her queen instead of Vashti.
zo: kumpipa in ama numei dangte khempeuh sangin itzaw a, a nungak dangte khempeuh sangin limbawl zaw hi. Tua hi a, kumpi lukhu amah khusakin Vashti’ tangin kumpinu a suaksak hi.

en: “Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Tell Me, if you have understanding.
zo: Leitung ka bawl laitakin nang om na hi hiam? Thei kisa na hih leh tua thu hong gen in.

en: There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under the heavens:
zo: Hih leitungah a piang thu khempeuh, Pasian in ama pian’ hun dinga a sehsa hunin a piansak ahi hi.

en: The flowers appear on the earth; the season of singing has come, and the cooing of doves is heard in our land.
zo: Gam sung tengah paakte palh a, lasak hun tung ta hi. Gam sung tengah vakhu hamte kiza ta hi.

en: And they called out to one another: “Holy, holy, holy is the LORD of Hosts; His glory fills the whole earth.”
zo: Amaute khatlekhat kisamin: “Vanglian Topa , siangtho, siangtho, siangtho; leitung khempeuh ama minthanna tawh kidim,” ci-in awng uh hi.

en: Because of the loving devotion of the LORD we are not consumed, for His compassions never fail.
zo: A bei thei lo Topa’ hong itna le a hehpihna a kizom paisuak hi a,

en: This is what the Lord GOD says to these bones: ‘I will cause breath to enter you, and you will come to life.
zo: Topa Pasian ahi keimah in amaute tungah ka gen thu hih bangin gen in: Note sungah hu kong guan ding a, note kong nungtasakkik ding hi.

en: This is the inscription that was written: MENE, MENE, TEKEL, PARSIN.
zo: Tua a kigelh laimal pen hih bang ahi hi: Mene, Mene, Tekel, Parsin.

en: I led them with cords of human kindness, with ties of love. To them I was like one who lifts a little child to the cheek, and I bent down to feed them.
zo: Amaute, itna le hehpihna tawh ka len a, domto-in ka biang ciangah ka tawi a, awn sukin an ka pia hi.

en: And afterward, I will pour out My Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions.
zo: “Tua khit ciangin mi khempeuh tungah ka kha ka sung ding a, na puteekte un mang manin na tangvalte un maang mu ding uh hi.

en: But let justice roll on like a river, and righteousness like a never-failing stream.
zo: Thutang, tui bangin luangkhiasak unla, thuman, a kang ngei lo tui bangin luangsak un.

en: Though you soar like the eagle and make your nest among the stars, from there I will bring you down,” declares the LORD.
zo: Muvanlai bangin sangpi-ah leengin, aksite lakah bu na bawl hangun no kong khiasuk veve ding hi, Topa in a ci hi.

en: He said: “In my distress I called to the LORD, and He answered me. From the depths of Sheol I called for help, and You listened to my cry.
zo: “Ka cihmawhna panin Topa ka sam a, amah in kei hong dawng hi. Sihna gam Sheol panin kong kiko a, nangmah in ka aw nong za hi.

en: He has shown you, O man, what is good. And what does the LORD require of you but to act justly, to love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God?
zo: Mun khempeuhah a om no mihingte aw, Topa in a hoih nate hong gen khinzo hi. Topa in note tung panin hong kalh thu in: Thuman thutang sem ding a, itna kip nei tawntungin, kiniamkhiatna tawh Pasian’ thu man’ ding ahi hi.

en: The LORD is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble. He knows those who take refuge in Him.
zo: Topa hoih hi; lungkham hunin a mite huh a, amah a beel mite limtakin a kem hi.

en: “Behold, the proud one’s soul is not right within him, but the righteous one will live by his faith.
zo: Tua a hong tung ding thu pen ‘A gilo mite suakta lo ding a, thuman mite ahihleh Pasian tungah a cihtak manun nungta ding hi,’” a hong ci hi.

en: The LORD your God is in your midst—a mighty Savior! He will rejoice over you with gladness; He will quiet you with His love; He will rejoice over you with singing.”
zo: Topa na Pasian un note hong ompih a, ama vangliatna in hong gualzosak hi. Note tungah Topa lungkim ding a, ama hong itna tawh hong thakbawl ding hi. Note’ hangin Topa lungdamin la sa ding a,

en: ‘The glory of this present house will be greater than the glory of the former house,’ says the LORD of Hosts. ‘And in this place I will grant peace,’ declares the LORD of Hosts.”
zo: Biakinn thak pen a lui sangin hoihzaw-in thupizaw ding hi. Hih biakinn-ah cihtheihna le nopsakna kong pia ding hi,” cisak hi.

en: So he answered me, “This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: ‘Not by might nor by power, but by My Spirit,’ says the LORD of Hosts.
zo: Tua ciangin vantungmi in kei kiangah, “ Topa in Zerubbabel tungah hih bangin thu gen hi: Galkap tam neihna hang hi lo, nangma vangliatna hang zong hi lo, keima tung panin na ngah vangliatna bek tawh na ma na tunzo ding hi.

en: “Behold, I will send My messenger, who will prepare the way before Me. Then the Lord whom you seek will suddenly come to His temple—the Messenger of the covenant, whom you desire, will surely come,” says the LORD of Hosts.
zo: Hih bangin na thugenna uh tawh kisai-in Vanglian Topa in hong dawng a, “Ka pai nading lampi a bawlkhol dingin ka kamtai pa ka sawl ding hi. Tua ciangin na ngakngak uh Topa a biakinn sungah thakhat thu-in hong pai ding hi. Na muhnop uh kamtai pa hong pai-in ka thuciamna hong taangko ding hi,” ci hi.

en: You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden.
zo: “Note pen leitung mite a dingin khuavak tawh na kibang uh hi. Mual dawnah a om khua kiseelcip thei lo hi.

en: He also said, “This is what the kingdom of God is like: A man scatters seed on the ground.
zo: Tua ciangin Jesuh in, “Pasian’ Ukna pen mi khat in a lolai-ah a vawh khaici tawh kibang hi.

en: I tell you that in the same way, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.
zo: Tua mah bangin kisikkik ding a kisam lo mihoih sawmkua le kuate tungah lungdamna sangin mawhnei mi khat a kisikna hangin vantungah lungdamna lianzaw ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: For God so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish but have eternal life.
zo: Pasian in leitung mite hong it mahmah ahih manin ama Tapa a um mi khempeuh si nawn loin a hin tawntung theih nadingun a Tapa neihsun a hong piak dongin a hong itna a hong lak hi.

en: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be My witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
zo: Ahi zongin note tungah Kha Siangtho hong tun ciangin vangliatna tawh na kidim ding uh a, Jerusalem khuasung, Judea gam sung, Samaria gam sung, le leimong dongin note in keima thu na gen ding uh hi,” ci-in a dawng hi.

en: For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor principalities, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers,
zo: Bangmah in ama hong itna tawh hong kikhensakzo het lo ding hi, ci-in ka thei hi. Sihna, nuntakna, vantung mite, vantung vangliatnate, tuhun nate le a hong tung ding nate,

en: And now these three remain: faith, hope, and love; but the greatest of these is love.
zo: Tu laitakin a omlai thu thumte pen upna, lametna, le itna hi a, tua thumte sung panin itna mah a thu lianpen ahi hi.

en: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.
zo: Tua ahih manin mi khatpeuh, Khrih tawh a kipawl ciangin mi thak suak a, a mi lui ngeina bei-in a mi thak ngeina a neita ahi hi.

en: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
zo: Ahi zongin Kha Siangtho’ sawlna bangin gamtatnate pen: Itna, lungdamna, lungnopna, lungduaina, migitna, hoihna, cihtakna,

en: For it is by grace you have been saved through faith, and this not from yourselves; it is the gift of God,
zo: Note’ upna hangin Pasian’ hong hehpihna tawh hotkhiatna a ngah na hi uh hi. Note’ thalawhna hangin a ngah hi loin Pasian’ hong piakkhong ahi hi.

en: I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.
zo: Khrih in a hong piak vangliatna tawh hihte khempeuh nawkzawh nading thahatna a nei ka hi hi.

en: For in Him all things were created, things in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or authorities. All things were created through Him and for Him.
zo: Vantung le leitungah a om na khempeuh, kha thu tawh kisai vangliatna, tote, mi ukte, aana neihnate a kipan a kimuthei hitaleh a kimu thei lo hitaleh na khempeuh, Pasian in amah zangin a piangsak hi. Leitung a kipanin huih lakah a om khempeuh dongin, Pasian in Khrih a dingin amahmah zangin a piangsak hi.

en: After that, we who are still alive and are left will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be with the Lord forever.
zo: Tua ciangin tua hun laitakin a nungta lai eite pen vankim lai-ah Topa a dawn dingin amah a um a sisa mite tawh hong kilakhawm ding a, Topa tawh i omkhawm tawntung ding hi, cihna ahi hi.

en: But the Lord is faithful, and He will strengthen you and protect you from the evil one.
zo: Note ahihleh, Topa citak mahmah ahih manin hong thahatsak ding a, A Gilopa kiang panin hong honkhia ding hi.

en: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. By craving it, some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many sorrows.
zo: Sum deihluatna in siatna namkim piangsak hi. Mi pawlkhat in sum deihlua liang uh ahih manin a upna panun pialkhia-in gimna lungkhamna tampi a thuaklawh uh hi.

en: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting, and training in righteousness,
zo: Pasian’ na a sem mite mi cingtaak hi-in, na hoih namkim a septheih nadingun Lai Siangtho pen Pasian’ lamlahna tawh a hong kipia hi a, thuman thutak hilh nading, a khialte taii nading, a man lote a manin puah nading, a manin nuntak theih nading thuhilh nadingin a manpha mahmah ahi hi.

en: He saved us, not by works of righteousness that we had done, but according to His mercy, through the washing of regeneration and renewal by the Holy Spirit,
zo: amah in eite hong honkhia hi. Eite in na hoih i sepzawhna hangin hong honkhia hi loin eite tungah suahtakna le nuntakna thak a hong pia Kha Siangtho in hong sawpsiangna hangin a hong hehpihna tawh a hong honkhia ahi hi.

en: I pray that your partnership in the faith may become effective in recognizing every good thing that is in us for the sake of Christ.
zo: Thu umte ihihna hangin Khristian sungah eite i kikholh manin, Khrih hangin i nuntakna sungah i ngah thupha a hoih khempeuh na theihna a kicin semsem nadingin thu ka ngen hi.

en: Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen.
zo: Upna nei i cih ciangin i muhtheih nai loh i lamette ngah takpi ding, ci-in muanna lungsim neihna ahi hi.

en: As the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without deeds is dead.
zo: Tua ahih manin hu a diik lo, hu a sang lo pumpi pen a si ahih mah bangin sepna tawh a kizom lo upna zong a si ahi hi.

en: But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, to proclaim the virtues of Him who called you out of darkness into His marvelous light.
zo: Ahi zongin note pen Pasian in a hong teelkhiat minam, Kumpi siampi pawl, a siangtho minam, Pasian’ mite na hi uh a, khuamial sung panin a lamdang mahmah ama khuavak sungah a hong samkhia pa’ nasepna a lamdangte a genkhia dingin Pasian in a hong teel mite na hi uh hi.

en: For no prophecy was ever produced by the will of man, but men spoke from God as they were carried along by the Holy Spirit.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh mihingte in a deih manin mailam thugenkholh theihna a kingah hi lo a, Kha Siangtho’ sawlna tawh Pasian’ kiang panin a hong pai thute a kigen ahi zaw hi.

en: Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love.
zo: Pasian pen ki-itna ahih manin itna a nei lo mite in Pasian thei lo uh hi.

en: And this is love: that we walk in obedience to His commands. This is the command, just as you have heard from the beginning: that you walk in love.
zo: Itna thu ka hong gen ciangin Pasian’ thupiakte zui ding cihna ahi hi. A kipat cil a kipan na zaksa uh ahi hih thupiakna pen na khan tawntungun zui-in itna na nei ta un.

en: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth.
zo: Tate bangin ka hong neih mite a mantakin a gamtatna uh ka zakna hangin ka lungdamna sangin adang lungdamna lianzaw bangmah om lo hi.

en: “I am the Alpha and the Omega,” says the Lord God, “who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.”
zo: A beisa hun, tuhun, le mailam hunah zong a om tawntung ding a Vanglian Topa Pasian in, “Kei pen na khempeuh a Kipatna le a Tawpna ka hi hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then the LORD God formed man from the dust of the ground and breathed the breath of life into his nostrils, and the man became a living being.
zo: Topa Pasian in leilak pana leivui tawh mihing bawl a, a nak sungah nuntakna hu sang suk hi. Tua mi pen leitung nuntakna a nei mihing hong suak pah hi.

en: God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM. This is what you are to say to the Israelites: ‘I AM has sent me to you.’”
zo: Pasian in Moses kiangah, “ Keimah ka hi hi,” ci hi. Tua ciangin Pasian in, “Israel mite tungah hih thu genin, ‘ Keimah a kici pa in note kiangah kei hong sawl hi,’ ci in,” a ci hi.

en: The LORD bless you and keep you;
zo: Topa in note thupha hong pia-in hong kem tahen.

en: But Ruth replied: “Do not urge me to leave you or to turn back from you. Where you go I will go, and where you stay I will stay. Your people will be my people and your God my God.
zo: Ahih hangin Ruth in, “Nang kong nusiat nading ahi a, nang zuihna panin ka ciahkik nading ahi zongin hong cici nawn kei in; bang hang hiam cih leh na paina-ah ka pai ding a, na giahna-ah ka giak ding hi. Na mite keima mite hi ding a, na Pasian keima Pasian hi ding hi.

en: Yours, O LORD, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the splendor and the majesty, for everything in heaven and on earth is Yours. Yours, O LORD, is the kingdom; You are exalted as Head over all.
zo: Topa aw, liatna, vangliatna, minthanna, gualzawhna, le min liatnate nangma a’ ahi hi; bang hang hiam cih leh vantung le leitungah a om khempeuh zong nangma a’ ahi hi. Topa aw, kumpi gam nangma a’ hi a, tuate khempeuh tungah nang a lutangin hong kisangsak hi.

en: if My people who are called by My name will humble themselves and pray and seek My face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and I will forgive their sin and will heal their land.
zo: keima minin a kisam ka mite amau mahmah kiniamkhiatin, thu ngenin ka mai hong zong a, amau’ gitlohnate panin a kihei uhleh, keimah in vantung panin ka za ding a, amaute’ khialhna maisakin a leitang uh ka hoihsakkik ding hi.

en: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
zo: Topa pen tuucin bangin hong cing hi a, kisapna teng kicing ta hi.

en: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and lean not on your own understanding.
zo: Na lungsim khempeuh tawh Topa muang inla, nang’ theihna suang kei in.

en: But those who hope in the LORD will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
zo: Ahih hangin Topa a muang mite a tha uh dimkik ding a, muvanlai bangin kha tawh leengto-in, amaute tai napi-un tawl lo ding uh a, amaute lam pai napi-un gim lo ding uh hi.

en: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa in kong cihin-ah, mai lamah lametna note kong piakkik ding, na siatna ding uh hi loin na phattuamna ding uh geelna ka neihte kei bek in ka thei hi.

en: But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
zo: Thudang khempeuh sangin Pasian’ ukna le ama deihna na zuih theih nading uh thupi ngaihsut masazaw un. Tua hileh hih na kisapna dangte khempeuh uh zong hong piathuah veve ding hi.

en: “Come to Me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
zo: “Na semin vangik pua-in a gim mite khempeuh aw, ka kiangah hong pai ta un. Note tungah lungsim tawldamna ka hong pia ding hi.

en: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
zo: A kipat cil-in Thu na om a, tua Thu, Pasian tawh na omkhawm a, tua Thu, Pasian ahi hi.

en: Jesus answered, “I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me.
zo: Jesuh in ama kiangah, “Keimah in Lampi ka hi a, Thuman, le Nuntakna zong ka hi hi. Kei hong suang loin Pa kiangah kuamah tung thei lo ding hi.

en: Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what is the good, pleasing, and perfect will of God.
zo: Leitung mihingte’ gamtat bangin gamta kei unla, na lungsim uh kikheelin Pasian kipuahphasak un. Tua hileh a hoih nate bang hi a, bangte in amah lungkimsakin, bangte a kicing hiam ci-in thei-in Pasian’ deihna na phawk thei ding uh hi.

en: For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world, and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.
zo: Eite’ do pen leitung mite hi lo a, vantung huihlakah a om ukna, aana a neite, hih leitung khuamial a uk a tuamtuamte ahi hi.

en: For the word of God is living and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it pierces even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow. It judges the thoughts and intentions of the heart.
zo: Pasian’ thu nungta-in a gamtang hi a, langnih a hiam namsau sangin hiamzaw lai hi. Kha le lungsim, guh le taang kituahna, guh le guhngek dongin khenkhia thei hi. Mihingte’ lungsim ngimna le a ngaihsutnate zong theithei hi.

en: ‘He will wipe away every tear from their eyes.’ There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.”
zo: Amaute’ mit panin khitui khempeuh nulsak ding hi. Thu luisate maimang khinta ahih manin sihna, dahna, le na sa-a kahna cihte om nawn lo ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: You intended to harm me, but God intended it for good to accomplish what is now being done, the saving of many lives.
zo: Note in ahihleh, kei’ tungah a sia dingin na ngaihsun uh hi. Ahih hangin Pasian in tuhuna mah bangin mi tampite a nuntak theihna a pian nadingin a hoih dingin a ngaihsut ahi hi.

en: You shall have no other gods before Me.
zo: “Keimah longal pasian dang na bia kei ding uh hi.

en: Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the LORD your God will be with you wherever you go.”
zo: Thu hong pia khin hi lo ka hi hiam? Thahat inla hang in. Lau kei inla lungkia kei in; bang hang hiam cih leh na paina peuhpeuhah Topa na Pasian nang tawh hong om hi,” a ci hi.

en: When the three companies blew their trumpets and shattered their jars, they held the torches in their left hands and the trumpets in their right hands, and they shouted, “A sword for the LORD and for Gideon!”
zo: A pawl thumun peengkul tumin beelte sukham uh a, a veilam khutun meilah tawi-in, a taklam khutun a tum ding uh peengkul tawi uh hi. Tua ciangin amaute kiko-in, “ Topa a’ ding le Gideon a’ ding namsau khat!” a ci uh hi.

en: But the LORD said to Samuel, “Do not look at his appearance or his height, for I have rejected him. For the LORD does not see as man sees; man looks at the outward appearance, but the LORD looks at the heart.”
zo: Ahih hangin Topa in Samuel kiangah, “A tungtham hitaleh a tun sanna hitaleh en kei in. Bang hang hiam cih leh amah ka nolh hi. Topa in mihingte’ muh bangin mu lo hi. Mihingte in a pualam a kilangte en a, ahih hangin Topa in a lungsim en hi,” a ci hi.

en: Elijah went before all the people and said, “How long will you waver between two opinions? If the LORD is God, follow Him; but if Baal is God, follow him.” But the people did not answer him a word.
zo: Tua ciangin mi khempeuh’ nai-ah Elijah hong pai-in, “Ngaihsutna kibang lo thu nih kikalah bang tanvei khensat loin om niloh ding na hi uh hiam? Topa pen Pasian ahihleh amah zui un; tua hi loin Baal pen Pasian ahihleh amah zui un,” a ci hi. Ahi zongin mite in kam khat beek dawng lo uh hi.

en: “Be still, and know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.”
zo: “Om hithiat unla, Pasian ka hihna thei un. Minamte lakah keimah hong kisangsak a, leitung khempeuhah ka min hong kithangsak hi,” a ci hi.

en: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
zo: Pasian aw, keima sungah lungsim siangtho hong piangsak inla, a thak a man ngaihsutna ka sungah hong guan in.

en: A man’s heart plans his way, but the LORD determines his steps.
zo: Mihing in thu geel a, ahi zongin Topa’ deihna bangin kisemkhia hi.

en: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given, and the government will be upon His shoulders. And He will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh eite a dingin naungek khat hong suak a, eite’ tungah tapa khat hong kipia hi. Amah pen eite hong ukpa hi ding a, ama min pen “Lamdang Thulak pa, Vanglian Pasian, Tawntung Pa, Nopsakna Kumpi,” kici ding hi.

en: But He was pierced for our transgressions, He was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed.
zo: Ahih hangin eite’ khialhna hangin amah kiliamsak a, eite’ mawhna hangin amah kisatnim hi. Ama gim thuakna hangin nopna i ngah a, ama liamna hangin damna i ngah hi.

en: The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure—who can understand it?
zo: “Na khempeuh lakah lungsim a khem hatpen hi a, a kisia pha mahmah ahi hi. Kua in lungsim theizo ding ahi hiam?

en: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
zo: Tua ahih ciangin note pai unla, midang khempeuh, keima nungzui mi suaksakin, Pa min, Tapa min, le Kha Siangtho min tawh tui sungah na phum un.

en: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh Mihing Tapa zong, midangte ama na a semsak dingin a hong pai hi lo hi. Midangte’ na a sem ding le mi tampi a tatkhiat nading ama nuntakna a pia dingin a hong pai ahi zaw hi,” a ci hi.

en: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh a mangthangte a zong ding le a honkhia dingin Mihing Tapa a hong pai ahi hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
zo: Tua ciangin thuman na thei ding uh a, tua thuman in note hong suaktasak ding hi,” a cih leh

en: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in Me will live, even though he dies.
zo: Tua ciangin Jesuh in, “Keimah in a sisa mite thosakin a hingsak thei pa ka hi hi. Kei hong um mi peuhmah a sih hangin nungta ding hi.

en: Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to men by which we must be saved.”
zo: Ama hang bek tawh hotkhiatna kingah thei ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh eite in hotkhiatna i ngahtheih nadingin leitung khempeuhah Pasian in hong piak min dang khat zong om lo hi,” ci-in a gen hi.

en: for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,
zo: Mi khempeuh mawh ciat uh a, a hong honkhia Pasian tawh kigamla uh hi.

en: For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh mawhna in thaman hong piak pen sihna hi a, ahi zongin i Topa Jesuh tawh i kipawl manin Pasian’ hong piakkhong pen nuntak tawntungna ahi hi.

en: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast and immovable. Always excel in the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin ka hong it sanggamte aw, Topa’ hangin na nasepnate uh a mawkna hi ngei het lo hi, ci-in na theih uh mah bangin Topa a dingin a tawntungin na sem unla, ling hetloin lungsim kiptakin na om ta un.

en: I have been crucified with Christ, and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.
zo: Tua ahih manin tuhuna ka nuntakna zia pen kei hang hi nawn loin ka sungah a hong om Khrih hang ahi hi. Tua hi a, keimah hong itin, keima a dingin a nuntakna a hong pia Pasian’ Tapa ka muanna tawh tu laitakin a nungta ka hi hi.

en: Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus:
zo: Note in Jesuh Khrih lungsim puakzia na nei un. Tua lungsim puak zia in:

en: For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and self-control.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh Pasian in eite tungah meidawina lungsim hong guan lo a, thahatna, ki-itna, pumpi ki-ukzawhna lungsim hong guan hizaw hi.

en: Let us fix our eyes on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy set before Him endured the cross, scorning its shame, and sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.
zo: Eite hong makai-in i upna a hong cingtaaksak Jesuh mitsuanin nei ni. Mailamah a ngah ding lungdamna hangin maizumna kihta loin singlamteh tungah sihna hong thuak a, tu-in Pasian tokhom taklamah a tu hi.

en: Cast all your anxiety on Him, because He cares for you.
zo: Pasian in note hong kem ahih manin na lungkhamnate khempeuh uh ama kiang tunpih un.

en: Behold, I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to him and dine with him, and he with Me.
zo: Kongkhakah dingin kong ka hong kiu hi. Ka aw za-in kong hong honte kiangah lutin an ka nekhawm ding uh hi.

en: And the reason the dream was given to Pharaoh in two forms is that the matter has been firmly decided by God, and God will do it soon.”
zo: Faro’ mang nih a phakna pen tua thu Pasian’ sehsa hi, a cihnopna hi a, Pasian in tomno sungin hong tungsak ding hi.

en: It will be a sign between Me and the Israelites forever, for in six days the LORD made the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day He rested and was refreshed.’”
zo: Ni guk sung teng Topa in van le lei bawlin, a ni sagih ni-in amah tawlnga a, a tha dimsakkik hi. Keimah le Israel mite’ kikalah hih Sabbath ni pen lim khat hi tawntung ding hi, ci hi,’ ci in,” a ci hi.

en: “You are to rise in the presence of the elderly, honor the aged, and fear your God. I am the LORD.
zo: “Note, sam kangte’ mai-ah na kun ding uh a, puteekte’ maitang zahtakin, na Pasian uh na kihta ding uh hi; kei pen Topa ka hi hi.

en: I see him, but not now; I behold him, but not near. A star will come out of Jacob; a scepter will rise out of Israel. He will crush the foreheads of Moab and tear down all the sons of Sheth.
zo: Amah ka mu hi; ahih hangin tunai hun hi lo hi: Jakob sung pan aksi khat hong suakkhia ding a, Israel sung pan kumpi ciangkhut hong piang ding hi. Tua in Moab thaltang satkham ding a, Sheth’ suante khempeuh sugawp ding hi.

en: He humbled you, causing you to hunger and then feeding you with manna, which neither you nor your fathers had known, to teach you that man does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of the LORD.
zo: Mite, an bek tawh nungta loin Topa’ kamsung panin a pusuak thu khempeuh tawh nungta hi, ci-in note hong theihsak nadingin, amah in note hong niamkhiatin hong gilkialsak a, note hitaleh na pu na pate uh hitaleh in a theih ngei loh manna tawh hong vak hi.

en: The commander of the LORD’s army replied, “Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy.” And Joshua did so.
zo: Tua ciangin Topa’ galkapte a ukpa in Joshua kiangah, “Na khe panin na khedapte suah in. Bang hang hiam cih leh na dinna mun a siangtho leitang ahi hi,” a ci hi. Tua bangmahin Joshua a gamta hi.

en: So he said to them: “Out of the eater came something to eat, and out of the strong came something sweet.” For three days they could not solve the riddle.
zo: Tua ciangin amah in amaute kiangah, “A ne pa sung panin nek ding pawlkhat hong piang a, a thahatpa sung panin a khum pawlkhat hong piang hi,” a ci hi. Ni thum sungin tua thuhaksa bang hiam cih gen thei lo uh hi.

en: “The LORD bless him!” Naomi said to her daughter-in-law. “He has not stopped showing his kindness to the living and the dead.” She added, “That man is our close relative; he is one of our kinsman-redeemers.”
zo: Tua ciangin Naomi in a monu kiangah, “A dikna in a site hitaleh a hingte hitaleh a mangngilh lo Topa in amah thupha pia ta hen,” a ci hi. Naomi in ama kiangah, “Tua mipa pen i behte, i tanau naipen khat ahi hi,” zong ci lai hi.

en: And David was greatly distressed because the men were talking of stoning him; each man was bitter in spirit because of his sons and daughters. But David strengthened himself in the LORD his God.
zo: David nakpitakin lungkham hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh mi khempeuh a tanu a tapate uh hangin lungsimsia uh ahih manin amaute in suang tawh amah den ding gen uh hi. Ahih hangin Topa a Pasian in David thakhauhsak hi.

en: For we will surely die and are like water spilled on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again. But God does not take away life; instead, He devises ways so that a banished person may not remain estranged from Him.
zo: Eite khempeuh i si ding a, a kikhawm kik thei lo leilakah a bua tui tawh i kibang hi. Ahih hangin a hawlkhiat pa a kipuasehin a kikoih loh nadingin lampi a zong mipa’ nuntakna Pasian in lakhia lo ding hi.

en: and observe the requirements of the LORD your God, walking in His ways and keeping His statutes, commandments, ordinances, and testimonies, as written in the Law of Moses, so that you may prosper in all you do and wherever you turn,
zo: Amah in kei tungah a hong gen, ‘Na tapate in a lungsim khempeuh uhleh a nuntakna khempeuh uh tawh keima mai-ah thuman takin gamtat ding limtakin a ngaihsut nak-uhleh Israel kumpi tokhom tungah khat beek in nang hong tamasak lo ding hi,’ ci-a a thugenna Topa in a kipsak theih nadingin, Moses thukham sungah a kigelh bangin Topa na Pasian’ thuhilhna zui-in, ama lampite hoihtakin tawn inla, ama thukhamte, a thupiakte, a biakna ngeina kipte hoihtakin zui in. Tua hileh na heksuk na hektohna khempeuhah na dau hong pai ding hi.

en: Then they served it for the men to eat, but as they began to eat the stew, they cried out, “O man of God, there is death in the pot!” And they could not eat it.
zo: Tua ciangin amaute in mite’ nek dingin hong thukkhia uh hi. Ahih hangin amaute in meh a nek laitakun amaute kiko-in, “Pasian’ mipa aw, an sungah gu om!” a ci uh hi. Amaute in ne thei lo uh hi.

en: from Issachar, men who understood the times and knew what Israel should do—200 chiefs with all their relatives under their command;
zo: Issakhar mi: Amaute sung panin Israel in bang a sep dingin kilawm cih a thei, hun paizia a thei ukpi zanih le amau’ ukna nuai-ah a om amau’ behte khempeuh ahi uh hi.

en: Early in the morning they set out for the Desert of Tekoa. As they set out, Jehoshaphat stood and said, “Listen to me, O Judah and people of Jerusalem! Have faith in the LORD your God and you will be upheld; have faith in His prophets and you will be successful.”
zo: Tua ciangin zingsangin amaute tho baihin Tekoa gamlakah a paikhia uh hi. Amaute a paikhiat laitakin Jehoshafat dingin, “Judah gam le Jerusalem-a a tengte aw, ka thugen za un! Topa na Pasian uh um un; tua hileh note na kip ding uh hi. Ama kamsangte um un; tua hileh na maavang ding uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the LORD, and to teaching its statutes and ordinances in Israel.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh Ezra in Topa’ thukham sinin zuih ding, le Israel mite a hilh dingin amah kipia hi.

en: So they read from the Book of the Law of God, explaining it and giving the meaning so that the people could understand the reading.
zo: Amaute in Pasian’ thukham laibu sung panin a kitel takin sim uh a, a cihnopna a kitelin gen uh a, tua a kisim thute a tel nadingun a hilh uh hi.

en: “Go, gather all the Jews who are in Susa, and fast for me. Do not eat or drink for three days, night or day. I and my maids will fast as you do. When this is done, I will go to the king, even though it is against the law. And if I perish, I perish.”
zo: “Pai-in Susa khua sunga om Jew mi khempeuh khawm inla, keimah ngaihsutna-in an na tang un. A sun a zan ci loin ni thum sung an ne lo, tui dawn loin na om un. Na tan’ uh mah bangin kei le ka nasem numeite in zong ka na tang ding uh hi. Tua khit ciangin ngeina ahihloh hangin kumpipa kiangah ka va pai ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: “I have made a covenant with my eyes. How then could I gaze at a virgin?
zo: “Lunggulhna tawh nungak khatpeuh ka et ngei loh nading, kiciamna ka bawlkhin hi.

en: He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to an idol or swear by what is false.
zo: Gamtat siangtho le lungsim siangtho a nei, a man lo thu-ah a nuntakna pia loin, khemna tawh a kiciam lo mite ahi hi.

en: Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain. Unless the LORD watches over the city, the watchmen stand guard in vain.
zo: Topa in inn lampih kei leh innlamte’ sepna a mawkna ahi hi. Topa in khuapi hutpih kei leh khuapi cingte’ cinna a mawkna ahi hi.

en: A word aptly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.
zo: A kilawm hunin kammal khat paukhiatna pen ngun pek tunga kham pek khat a kisuang tawh kibang hi.

en: Cast your bread upon the waters, for after many days you will find it again.
zo: Sumbawl nadingin na sumte zang in. Ni khat ni peuh teh a meet na ngah ding hi.

en: I form the light and create darkness, I bring prosperity and create disaster; I, the LORD, do all these things.
zo: Keimah in khuavak le khuamial piangsakin, a pha nate le a sia nate ka piangsak a, hih nate khempeuh a bawlpa, keimah Topa ka hi hi,” a ci hi.

en: You will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.
zo: Note in kei nong zong ding uh a, na lungsim khempeuh uh tawh nong zon uh ciangin nong mu ding uh hi.

en: TEKEL: You have been weighed on the scales and found wanting.
zo: Tekel pen kitawikhai a cihna hi a, nang hong kitawikhai-in na lek zo kei hi, a cihna ahi hi.

en: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called sons of God.
zo: Kilem nading deihin a hanciam mite in Pasian’ tate cihna ngah ding uh ahih manin thupha ngah mi ahi uh hi.

en: Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but not with God. For all things are possible with God.”
zo: Jesuh in amaute enin, “Mihingte a dingin hi zo lo mah hi; ahi zongin Pasian a dingin ahi mawh thu hi lo hi; Pasian a dingin na khempeuh hithei hi,” a ci hi.

en: Whoever is faithful in very little is also faithful in much, and whoever is dishonest in very little is also dishonest in much.
zo: “A tawmno-ah a diktatte pen a tamah zong diktat uh a, a tawmno-ah a citak lote pen a tamah zong citak lo uh hi.

en: By this all men will know that you are My disciples, if you love one another.”
zo: Note khatlekhat ki-it le-uhcin keima nungzuite na hihna uh mi khempeuh in hong thei ding uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: From one man He made every nation of men, that they should inhabit the whole earth; and He determined their appointed times and the boundaries of their lands.
zo: Mihing khat tung panin leitung minam khempeuh hong piangsakin, leitung khempeuhah a omsak hi. Amah in mihingte a piansakma pekin, mihingte’ nuntak tanvei ding le a ten nading uh mun a sehsa ahi hi.

en: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
zo: Tua ahih manin gitlohna kizosak kei unla, a pha gamtatna tawh gitlohnate a zo na hi ta un.

en: Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one receives the prize? Run in such a way as to win the prize.
zo: Tai kidemna-ah mi khat bek in thaman a ngah ding hinapi-in a vekpi-un tai veve uh hi. Tua ahih manin thaman na ngahzawh nadingun na tai un.

en: Brothers, if someone is caught in a trespass, you who are spiritual should restore him gently. But watch yourself, or you also may be tempted.
zo: Sanggamte aw, mi khatpeuh a gamta khial a om ciangin, Kha Siangtho’ deihna bangin a nungta note in tua a khial pa a manin a gamtatkik theih nadingin thunem zangin na huh un. Note in zong amah bangin ze-etna na tuahkhak loh nadingun na kikem un.

en: Let no unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.
zo: Na kiho uh ciangin kamguh zang kei unla, na pauna uh a za mite in phattuamna a ngahtheih nadingin na-in a kimang kam hoihte bek na pau un.

en: I am not saying this out of need, for I have learned to be content in any circumstance.
zo: Bangbangin om taleng a lungkim thei dingin a kisinsa ka hih manin hih bang ka hong gen ciangin ka kitangsapna a hong pulak nuam ka hi kei hi.

en: Set your minds on things above, not on earthly things.
zo: Vantungah a om thute ngaihsutin nei unla, leitungah a om thute ngaihsutin nei kei un.

en: pray without ceasing,
zo: thu ngen niloh unla,

en: Therefore, if anyone cleanses himself from what is dishonorable, he will be an instrument for noble purposes, made holy, useful to the Master, and prepared for every good work.
zo: Mi khatpeuh a hoih lo na khempeuh panin kikemin a siangtho takin a om nakleh na hoih nam khempeuh a sem dingin a Topa tungah ki-apin, a Topa tungah a manpha suak ahih manin a thupi diakte-ah amah kizang ding hi.

en: Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, “Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.”
zo: Sum deihluatna tawh na kipelh nadingun na nuntakna uhah kikem unla, na neihzah uh tawh lungkim un. Pasian in, “Note ka hong nusia ngei kei ding a, ka hong tamasak ngei kei ding hi,” hong ci hi.

en: My dear brothers, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry,
zo: Sanggamte aw, note in na theih ding uh ka deih thu in: Thu kigen khempeuh hoihtakin ngai pahpah un. Ahi zongin pau pahpah kei unla, heh pakpak kei un.

en: Finally, all of you, be like-minded and sympathetic, love as brothers, be tenderhearted and humble.
zo: A tawpna-ah kong gennop thu in: Lungsim le ngaihsutna kikhat nei-in unau ki-itna lungsim nei unla, migi-in kiniamkhiat un.

en: But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be the glory both now and forever. Amen.
zo: Hehpihna thu le i Topa le Honpa Jesuh Khrih theihna thu-ah na khangto semsem zaw un. Tuhun a kipanin a tawntungin amah in minthanna ngah paisuak tahen. Amen.

en: This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down His life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers.
zo: Itna i cih bangci theih ding ihi hiam cih leh: Khrih in eite a dingin a nuntakna hong pia hi. Ei zong i Khristian mipihte a dingin i nuntakna i piak ngam ding ahi hi.

en: I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have, so that no one will take your crown.
zo: Keimah ka hong pai baih ding hi. Kuamah in, na ngah ding uh gualzawhna lukhu hong tuhkhak loh nadingun na neihsate uh hoihtakin na lenkip un.

en: The scepter will not depart from Judah, nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet, until he to whom it belongs comes and the obedience of the nations is his.
zo: Judah in kumpi ciangkhut len tawntung ding a, a suan a khakte in zong ukna aana nei tawntung ding hi. Minam dangte in ama tungah siah puak ding a, zahtakna tawh ama mai-ah kun ding uh hi.

en: The LORD is my strength and my song, and He has become my salvation. He is my God, and I will praise Him, my father’s God, and I will exalt Him.
zo: Topa , kei a hong hupa hi a, keimah hong honkhia pa ahi hi. Amah, keima Pasian hi a, amah ka phat ding hi. Ka pa’ Pasian hi a, amah ka liansak ding hi.

en: I will walk among you and be your God, and you will be My people.
zo: Keimah, note’ lakah omin note’ Pasian ka hi ding a, note, keima mite na hi ding uh hi.

en: But if you fail to do this, you will be sinning against the LORD; and you may be sure that your sin will find you out.
zo: Ahih hangin note tua bangin na gamtat kei uhleh, en un, Topa’ tungah a khial khin na hi uh hi. Na khialhna un note hong sulzuih ding theitel un.

en: And now, O Israel, what does the LORD your God ask of you but to fear the LORD your God, to walk in all His ways, to love Him, to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
zo: “Israel-te aw, tu-in, Topa na Pasian uh zahtak ding, ama lampite tot ding, amah it ding, na lungsim khempeuh uh le na nuntakna khempeuh uh tawh Topa note’ Pasian’ na sep ding,

en: So on that day Moses swore to me, ‘The land on which your feet have walked will be your inheritance and that of your children forever, because you have followed the LORD my God wholeheartedly.’
zo: Tua ni-in Moses kiciamin, ‘Nangmah in Topa ka Pasian, lungsim tak tawh zui na hih manin na khe in a totsa leitang pen nang le na tate a dingin gamh hi tawntung ding hi,’ hong ci hi.

en: In those days Israel had no king; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
zo: Tua hun lai-in Israel-te sungah kumpi om lo a, amau’ hoihsak bang ciatin mi khempeuh a gamta uh hi.

en: Then the women said to Naomi, “Blessed be the LORD, who has not left you without a kinsman-redeemer today. May his name be famous in Israel.
zo: Tua ciangin nupite in Naomi kiangah, “Tanau nei loin tuni-in nang a hong omsak lo Topa in thupha ngah hen la, Israel-te’ sungah ama min thang ta hen!

en: David said to the Philistine, “You come against me with sword and spear and javelin, but I come against you in the name of the LORD of Hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.
zo: Tua ciangin David in Filistia-pa kiangah, “Namsau, teipi, le teikhawh tawh kei kiangah nang nong kuan hi. Ahih hangin kei pen Israel galkapte’ Pasian, a Vanglian Topa, nangmah in na to mipa’ min tawh nang kiangah kong kuan hi.

en: Now be pleased to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue forever in Your presence. For You, O Lord GOD, have spoken, and with Your blessing the house of Your servant will be blessed forever.”
zo: Tua ahih ciangin tu-in nangma mai-ah a om tawntung theih nadingin na nasempa’ suanlekhakte thupha piak ding hong lungkim in. Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa Pasian aw, nangmah in na gen khin a, nangma thupha tawh na nasempa’ suanlekhakte thupha kipia tawntung ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: Answer me, O LORD, answer me, so that these people will know that You, O LORD, are God, and that You are turning their hearts back again.”
zo: Topa aw, nangmah Pasian na hihna le amaute’ lungsim na heikikna thu hih mite in a theih nadingin hong dawng in, Topa aw, hong dawng in,” a ci hi.

en: So now, O LORD our God, please save us from his hand, so that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that You alone, O LORD, are God.”
zo: Tua ahih ciangin tu-in, Topa kote’ Pasian aw, leitung kumpi gam khempeuh in nang, nang bek Pasian na hihna a theih nadingun ama khutsung panin kote hong honkhia in, kong thum hi, Topa aw,” a ci hi.

en: “But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to give as generously as this? For everything comes from You, and we have given You only what comes from Your own hand.
zo: “Ahih hangin kote in hih bangin utna tawh kong piak nadingun kei kua hi a, ka mite bang ahi hiam? Bang hang hiam cih leh na khempeuh nang kiang pan hong pai hi a, nangma a’ mah nang tungah a hong pia ka hi uh hi.

en: With him is only an arm of flesh, but with us is the LORD our God to help us and to fight our battles.” And the people were encouraged by the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.
zo: Amah in mihing thahatna nei a, ahih hangin eite hong huhin i gal hong dosak dingin Topa i Pasian in eite hong ompih hi,” a ci hi. Tua ahih ciangin mite in Judah kumpipa Hezekiah’ kammalte a muang uh hi.

en: So we fasted and petitioned our God about this, and He answered our prayer.
zo: Tua hi a, kote in an ka tang uh hi. Nuamtakin khual ka zin theih nading uh i Pasian’ tungah ka ngen uh a, amah in ka thungetna uh hong pia hi.

en: After I looked things over, I stood up and said to the nobles, the officials, and the rest of the people, “Don’t be afraid of them. Remember the Lord, who is great and awesome, and fight for your brothers, your sons and your daughters, your wives and your homes.”
zo: Mite’ launa ka muh ciangin, uliante, mi ukte, le mi khempeuh tungah, “Amaute kihta kei un. Na sanggamte, na tapate, na tanute, na zite uh, le na inn na lote uh a dingin hong dosak, a lian a kihtakhuai Topa phawk un,” ka ci hi.

en: For the Jews it was a time of light and joy and gladness and honor.
zo: Tua hi a, Jew mite in suahtakna, lungdamna, le pahtawina ngah uh hi.

en: But He knows the way that I take; when He has tested me, I will come forth as gold.
zo: Ahi zongin Pasian in ka kalsuanna khempeuh thei a, kei hong ze-et leh ka sianthona a mu ding hi.

en: When I am afraid, I will trust in You.
zo: Kei ka lau ciangin nangmah ka hong muang hi.

en: He will cover you with His feathers, and under His wings you will find refuge; His faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
zo: Amah in a khate tawh nang hong tuam ding a, ama khate’ nuai-ah bukna ding na mu ding hi. Ama thumanna in nang hong dalin hong hu ding hi.

en: Do not boast about tomorrow, for you do not know what a day may bring.
zo: Zing ciang hun ading kima-sialh kei in. Tuhun le tua hun kikalah a piang ding thu bangmah na thei kei hi.

en: Remember your Creator in the days of your youth, before the days of trouble come and the years approach when you will say, “I find no pleasure in them”
zo: Na lungkham hun ding a hong tun ma, “Nuntak nuamsa kei ing,” na cih ma hun, na khangno lai-in nang hong Piangsak pa phawk in.

en: Yet You, O LORD, are our Father; we are the clay, and You are the potter; we are all the work of Your hand.
zo: Ahi zongin Topa aw, nang pen kote’ Pa na hi hi. Kote pen tungman bang hi-in, nang pen beelseek pa bang na hi a, kote khempeuh nangma bawl mite ka hi uh hi.

en: They will fight against you but will not overcome you, for I am with you to rescue you,” declares the LORD.
zo: Amaute in nang’ langkhatah hong do ding uh hi. Ahih hangin a hong zo kei ding uh hi; bang hang hiam cih leh Topa in kong cihin-ah, nangmah a hong hu dingin ka hong ompih ding hi,” a hong ci hi.

en: For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh.
zo: Tua thu hangin pasal in a nu le a pa nusia-in a zi tawh kigawm a, amau tegel pum khat a bang uh hi.

en: By day the LORD went ahead of them in a pillar of cloud to guide them on their way, and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light, so that they could travel by day or night.
zo: Amaute, sun hitaleh zan hitaleh khualzinin a pai theih nadingun sunin amaute lam a lak dingin meii khuam khat tawh, zanin amaute khuavak a pia dingin mei khuam khat tawh, amaute’ mai-ah Topa a pai hi.

en: For the life of a creature is in the blood, and I have given it to you to make atonement for yourselves on the altar; it is the blood that makes atonement for one’s life.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh pumpi nuntakna pen si sungah om hi. Note a’ ding kilemna bawl nadingin note a dingin biakna tau tungah tua si ka piazo hi. Si pen nuntakna ahih manin kilemna a piangsak na ahi hi.

en: the LORD make His face shine upon you and be gracious to you;
zo: Topa in note tungah a maitang hong taangsakin note hong ompih tahen.

en: If a prophet speaks in the name of the LORD but the thing does not take place or prove true, it is a message the LORD has not spoken. The prophet has spoken presumptuously. Do not be afraid of him.
zo: kamsang khat in Topa’ min tawh thu genin, tua thu pen hong tung lo ahi a, a man lo ahi zongin hong hih leh, tua thu pen Topa’ gen loh thu ahi hi. Kamsangpa in ama utthu a gen hi a, amah na kihtak ding uh kul lo hi.

en: No one will be able to stand against you all the days of your life. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will never leave you nor forsake you.
zo: Na nuntak sung tawntung kuamah in na mai hong khak zo lo ding hi. Moses tawh ka om mah bangin nang tawh zong kong om ding hi. Nang kong tamasak kei ding a, kong nusia kei ding hi.

en: When he saw her, he tore his clothes and cried, “Oh, my daughter! You have brought me to my knees! You have become the source of my trouble. For I have made a vow to the LORD and I cannot take it back.”
zo: Amah in a tanu a muh ciangin a puan balkekin, “Ala, ka tanu! Kei nong niamkoih mahmah hi. Kei a dingin lungkhamna lianpi nong suak hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa tungah thu ka ciam khin a, ka thuciamna ka dokkik thei kei hi,” a ci hi.

en: At this, they wept aloud again. Then Orpah kissed her mother-in-law goodbye, but Ruth clung to her.
zo: Tua ciangin amaute a kap kik uh hi. Orpah in a teeknu namin ciah a, ahih hangin Ruth in a teeknu beel hi.

en: After David had finished talking with Saul, Jonathan became one in spirit with David, and he loved him as himself.
zo: David le Saul a kiho khit a kipanin Saul’ tapa Jonathan in ama pumpi zahin David a it hi.

en: The king was shaken. He went up to the room over the gateway and wept. And as he went, he said: “O my son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! If only I had died instead of you! O Absalom, my son, my son!”
zo: Tua ciangin kumpipa’ lungsim nakpitakin sukha a, kulhkongpi tunga inndei sungah paito-in a kap hi. A paikawmin amah in, “Aw ka tapa Absalom, ka tapa, ka tapa Absalom! Nangma tangin kei sizaw taleng. Aw Absalom, ka tapa, ka tapa!” a ci hi.

en: But he himself went a day’s journey into the wilderness. He came to a broom tree, sat down under it, and prayed that he might die. “I have had enough, LORD,” he said. “Take my life, for I am no better than my fathers.”
zo: Ahih hangin amahmah gamlakah ni khat lam pailai-in poding kung nuai khatah a tu hi. Tua ciangin amah in a sih nading thu ngenin, “Phazo hi; tu-in Topa aw, ka nuntakna hong la ta in; bang hang hiam cih leh ka pate sangin kei ka hoihzaw kei hi,” a ci hi.

en: “Go and inquire of the LORD for me, for the people and for all Judah about what is written in this book that has been found. For great is the wrath of the LORD that is kindled against us because our fathers have not obeyed the words of this book, nor have they done according to all that is written for us.”
zo: “Pai unla, a kimu hih laibu sunga thute tawh kisai-in keima a’ ding, mite a’ ding, le Judah mi khempeuh a dingin Topa’ tungah thu va dong un; bang hang hiam cih leh hih laibu sunga thu, eite tawh kisai-in a kigelh khempeuh bangin gamtat ding i pu i pate in na mang lo uh ahih manin eite tungah Topa’ hehna lian hi,” a ci hi.

en: And now, You have been pleased to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue forever before You. For You, O LORD, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever.”
zo: Tua ahih ciangin tu-in nangma mai-ah a kizop tawntung theih nadingin na nasempa’ suanlekhakte thupha na piak ding nang hong lungkim ta in; bang hang hiam cih leh Topa aw, nangmah in thupha na piaksate a tawntungin thupha ngah ahi hi,” a ci hi.

en: My sons, do not be negligent now, for the LORD has chosen you to stand before Him, to minister to Him, and to be His ministers and burn incense.”
zo: Ka tate aw, Topa in ama omna-ah a ding ding, ama na a sem ding, le ama nasemte hi-in ama tungah paknamtui a hal dingin note hong teel khin ahih manin tu-in mawk om kei un,” a ci hi.

en: So the family heads of Judah and Benjamin, along with the priests and Levites—everyone whose spirit God had moved—prepared to go up and build the house of the LORD in Jerusalem.
zo: Tua ciangin Judah le Benjamin sunga innkuan lutangte, le siampite le Levi mite, Jerusalem khua-a om Topa’ biakinn a lamkik dingin a lungsim sung uhah Pasian in a suahsak mite khempeuh kithawi uh hi.

en: Remember me for this, O my God, and do not blot out my deeds of loving devotion for the house of my God and for its services.
zo: Ka Pasian aw, hih thu tawh kisai-in kei hong phawk inla, ka Pasian’ biakinn le a nasep nadingin ka sepsa gamtat hoihte maimangsak kei in.

en: That night, the king could not sleep; so he ordered the book of the chronicles, the record of his reign, to be brought in and read to him.
zo: Tua zanin kumpipa ihmu thei lo a, nisim thupiang ciaptehna Khang Tangthu Laibu lasak a, ama zakin tua laibu kisim hi.

en: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:
zo: Tua ciangin huihpi lak panin Topa in Job tungah thu hong gen a,

en: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
zo: Ama khialhna kimaisak a, ama mawhna a kiselcipsak mi, thupha ngah ahi hi.

en: The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
zo: Innlamte in a nilkhiat suang pen innkiu suang bulpi suak khinta hi.

en: Commit your works to the LORD, and your plans will be established.
zo: Na geelnate khempeuh Topa ap in; tua hileh na geelna bangin tangtung ding hi.

en: There is nothing better for a man than to eat and drink and to find joy in his work. This too, I saw, is from the hand of God.
zo: Mihing khat in a nasepna thamanin an ne tui dawnin nuamsa-in a om sangin a hoihzaw bangmah dang om lo hi. Ahi zongin tua nangawn zong, Pasian’ hang ahihna ka phawk hi.

en: He will swallow up death forever. The Lord GOD will wipe away the tears from all faces; He will remove the disgrace of His people from all the earth. For the LORD has spoken.
zo: Amah in sihna beimangsak ding a, maitang khempeuh panin khitui nul ding hi. Leitung khempeuh panin ama mite a kizahkona lakhia ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa in hih thu gen khinzo hi.

en: “I, the LORD, search the heart; I test the mind to reward a man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his deeds.”
zo: Keimah Topa in mi khempeuh’ nuntakzia le a gamtatna tawh kizui-in a piakhia dingin ngaihsutna ka entel a, lungsim ka sittel hi,” a ci hi.

en: Let us examine and test our ways, and let us return to the LORD.
zo: I gamtatnasate limtakin ki-enpha kikin Topa’ lamah kiheikik ni.

en: And I will give them a single heart and I will put a new spirit within them; I will remove their heart of stone and give them a heart of flesh,
zo: Amaute tungah lungsim thak le ngaihsutna thak ka pia ding hi. Amaute’ suang lungtang paihkhiat sakin mihing lungtang ka guan ding hi.

en: In my vision at night I looked, and there before me was one like a son of man, coming with the clouds of heaven. He approached the Ancient of Days and was led into His presence.
zo: Zan ka maangmuh hun sungin ka khuadak leh mihing tawh a kibang mi khat meii tungah a hong pai ka mu hi. A nungta tawntung mipa kiangah pai-in, ama kiangah a kipia hi.

en: Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me; for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
zo: Keima hakkol zamin kisuan unla, kei kiangah hong kisin dih un. Kei pen kiniamkhiatin nem hithiat ka hih manin ka kiangah na tawl uh a dam ding hi.

en: Then He said, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
zo: Tua ciangin Jesuh in, “Zak nading bil a neite in hih thu za ta un,” ci-in a thugen a khum hi.

en: And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and man.
zo: Jesuh a pumpi le a pilna khang a, ama gamtatna in Pasian le mite a lungkimsak semsem hi.

en: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
zo: “Kei, tuucing hoih ka hi hi. Tuucing hoih in a tuute sihpih ngam hi.

en: In everything I have shown you that by hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words of the Lord Jesus Himself: ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”
zo: Topa Jesuh mahmah in, ‘Ngahna sangin piak khiatna-ah lungdamna lianzaw hi,’ a cihna phawkkawmin nakpitakin nasepna tawh na khempeuhah a zawngkhalte huh ding hi hang, ci-in note kiangah kong lak khinzo hi,” ci-in a vaikhak hi.

en: Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
zo: Ahi zongin tu-in ahihleh Khrih Jesuh tawh kipawlin a nungta mite pen mawhna thukhenna tawh kipelh hi.

en: For what I received I passed on to you as of first importance: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,
zo: Kei tungah a hong kihilh a thupi pen note tungah ka hong gensawn a, tua in: Lai Siangtho sungah a kigelh mah bangin eite’ mawhna tang dingin Khrih hong si-in

en: Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith; test yourselves. Can’t you see for yourselves that Jesus Christ is in you—unless, of course, you fail the test?
zo: Thu um taktak mah ihi hiam, ci-in nomau mahmah na ki-entel ciat un. Na ki-ettelna uhah a cingtaak lo na hih kei nak-uhleh note sungah Khrih om ahih manin thu phawk un.

en: So I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh.
zo: Note kiangah ka hong gen thu in: Kha Siangtho’ hong sawlna bangin gamta unla, na pumpi uh utna bangin gamta kei un.

en: Do not get drunk on wine, which leads to debauchery. Instead, be filled with the Spirit.
zo: Zu in mi siasak thei ahih manin zu ne kei unla, Kha Siangtho tawh a kidimin omzaw un.

en: I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
zo: Khrih Jesuh nasepna tawh vantung nuntakna-ah Pasian’ hong sapna ahi hamphatna ka ngahtheih nadingin, a kung lam zuanin tangtakin ka tai hi.

en: To them God has chosen to make known among the Gentiles the glorious riches of this mystery, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
zo: Pasian in mi khempeuh a dingin a koihcing hih a thupi a deihhuai a thusim pen ama mite tungah pholak ding a sawm ahi hi. Tua thusim in: Khrih tawh a kipawlte in Pasian tawh minthanna ngahkhawm ding hi, cihna ahi hi.

en: and to make it your ambition to lead a quiet life: You should mind your own business and work with your hands, just as we told you,
zo: Tu ma-a ka hong gensa uh mah bangin kamtam nuam se loin hoihtakin om hithiatna, no tawh a kisai thu bek ngaihsutna, le note’ nuntak nading na na sep nading uh hanciamin nei un.

en: And as for you, brothers, never tire of doing what is right.
zo: Sanggamte aw, note in a hoihin gamtat ding na cimtak ngei het kei ta un.

en: If anyone does not provide for his own, and especially for his own household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
zo: Mi khatpeuh in a beh a phung, a diakdiakin a innkuansung mite a vak nop kei leh a upna a nusia hita a, thu um lo mite sangin siazaw lai hi.

en: Endure hardship with us like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
zo: Khrih Jesuh’ galkap hoih hihna tawh thuak dingin a kisam khempeuh na na thuak in.

en: In everything, show yourself to be an example by doing good works. In your teaching, show integrity, dignity,
zo: Nangma pumpi mahmah gamtat hoihna a kipan thu khempeuhah etteh hoih dingin na om in. Lungsim takpi tawh mite’ zahtaktheih dingin thu na hilh inla,

en: Make every effort to live in peace with all men and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord.
zo: Mi khempeuh tawh na kilem theih nading uh hanciam un. Nuntak siangtho lo tawh kuamah in Topa mu zo lo ding ahih manin nuntak siangtho na nungta un.

en: But the wisdom that comes from heaven is first of all pure; then peace-loving, considerate, submissive, full of mercy and good fruit, impartial and sincere.
zo: Ahi zongin tunglam panin a kingah pilna a siangtho ahi hi. Mi tawh kilem thei-in dik a, mi tawh kikhawl thei a, hehpihna lungsim nei-in gamtat hoih a, mi lang-et lo a, kineihkhem cihte om lo hi.

en: Therefore, prepare your minds for action; be self-controlled; set your hope fully on the grace to be given you when Jesus Christ is revealed.
zo: Tua ahih manin na lungsim uh ki-ukin a kigingsa-in om unla, Jesuh Khrih hong kilat ni ciangin na ngah ding uh hehpihna thupha ngaihsutin nei un.

en: Therefore, my brothers, be all the more eager to make your calling and election sure. For if you do these things, you will never fall,
zo: Tua ahih manin sanggamte aw, Pasian in note hong sapna le hong teelna-ah a kip taktak na hih nadingun hahkat mahmah un. Tua bangin hahkat le-uhcin na puk ngei kei ding uh hi.

en: My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you will not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father—Jesus Christ, the Righteous One.
zo: Ka itte aw, note na khialhkhak loh nading uh ka deihna-in hih lai a hong gelh ka hi hi. Ahi zongin mi khatpeuh a khialh ciangin eite a dingin Pa Pasian kiangah a hong thumsak dingin a thuman Jesuh Khrih i nei hi.

en: Blessed is the one who reads the words of this prophecy, and blessed are those who hear it and take to heart what is written in it, because the time is near.
zo: Hih laibu a sim mite mi hampha hi a, hih thu kigente ngai-in, hih laibu sungah a kigelh thu a zuite zong mi hampha mah ahi uh hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh hih thu kigente a tun ding hun hong naita hi.

en: Then the man said, “Your name will no longer be Jacob, but Israel, because you have struggled with God and with men and have overcome.”
zo: Tua ciangin amah in, “Na min Jakob, kici nawn loin Israel, kici ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Pasian le mite tawh na kilai khinzo a, na zo hi,” a ci hi.

en: and you will be for Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words you are to speak to the Israelites.”
zo: note pen keima siampi nasep a sem minam, le minam siangtho na hi ding uh hi. Israel mite tungah hih thute na gen ding ahi hi,” a ci hi.

en: For the LORD your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa na Pasian uh hong kangtum thei mei tawh kibang a, a haza Pasian ahi hi.

en: “There is no one holy like the LORD; there is no one besides You; there is no Rock like our God.
zo: “ Topa bangin a siangtho kuamah dang om lo a, amah simloh kuamah dang om lo a, i Pasian tawh a kibang hong hu dang om lo hi.

en: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.
zo: Pasian, i belh leh i thahatna hi a, haksat hunin a hong huh pahpah pa ahi hi.

en: but whoever listens to me will live in safety and be at ease, without fear of harm.”
zo: Ahi zongin ka thugenna a ngaite in lungnopna ngah ding uh a, launa nei loin nuamtakin om hithiat ding uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: so is My word that goes out from My mouth: It will not return to Me empty, but will accomplish what I desire and achieve the purpose for which I sent it.
zo: keima kam panin a paikhia ka thu zong tua mah bang ding hi. A hawmpi-in kei kiangah hong tungkik lo ding a, keima ngimnasa bangin tangtung sakin, amah ka sawlna thu tangtun ding hi.

en: But blessed is the man who trusts in the LORD, whose confidence is in Him.
zo: “ Topa muangin amah a beel mi in thupha a ngah ahi hi.

en: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh na sum omna uhah na lungsim uh om tawntung ding hi.

en: “I am the vine; you are the branches. If a man remains in Me and I in him, he will bear much fruit; apart from Me you can do nothing.
zo: “Kei pen leenggui ka hi a, note pen a hiang na hi uh hi. Note in kei tawh loin bangmah hih thei lo ding na hih manun kei tawh a kizomte in gah tampi na gah ding uh hi.

en: O, the depth of the riches of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable His judgments, and untraceable His ways!
zo: Tua ahih manin Pasian’ hong hehpihna nakliat mahmah a, a pilna le a thu theihnate nakthuk mahmah hi. Ama thukhennate kua’ gentheih ding hi lo a, a nasepna ziate kua’ telzawh ding hi lo hi.

en: For no one can lay a foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ.
zo: Keima phuhsa khuam thupiteng ahi Jesuh Khrih cih simloh kuamah dang in khuam thupi dang phutthei nawn lo ding hi.

en: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive what is due him for the things done while in the body, whether good or bad.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh Khrih mai-ah thusitna a thuak dingin eite khempeuh a kilak ding ihi a, leitung i pumpi-in i omlai-in i gamtatna tawh kizui-in eite tawh a kituak ciatin a sia ahi a, a pha ahi zongin a ngah ciat ding ihi hi.

en: Consequently, you are no longer foreigners and strangers, but fellow citizens with God’s people and members of God’s household,
zo: Tua ahih ciangin no Gentail mite pen a pualam mi, gamdang mite na hi nawn kei uh a, Pasian mite tawh minam khat hita-in, Pasian innkuan sung mite na hita uh hi.

en: And my God will supply all your needs according to His glorious riches in Christ Jesus.
zo: A na ka sep i Topa Pasian in ama hauhna tawh kizui-in Khrih Jesuh hangin note’ kitangsapna khempeuh hong pia ding hi.

en: who wants all men to be saved and to come to a knowledge of the truth.
zo: Mi khempeuh in hotkhiatna ngahin, thuman a theihkim ding Pasian in deih hi.

en: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are—yet was without sin.
zo: Eite’ neih Siampi Lianpen pa in i ginat lohna-ah eite a hong hehpih thei lo ding hi lo hi; eite mah bangin ze-etna khempeuh a thuak hi a, ahi zongin mawhna a bawl lo ahi hi.

en: Humble yourselves, therefore, under God’s mighty hand, that He may lift you up in due time.
zo: Pasian in ama hoihsak hun ciangin note hong laptoh theih nadingin a thahat Pasian’ khutnuai-ah kiniamkhiatin na om un.

en: So when the Midianite merchants came by, his brothers pulled Joseph out of the cistern and sold him for twenty shekels of silver to the Ishmaelites, who took him to Egypt.
zo: Tua ciangin Midian mi sumbawlte in hong nawk hi. Amaute in Josef kai to-in dum sung panin domkhia to uh a, Ishmael mite tungah ngun shekel sawmnihin amah zuak uh a, amaute in Egypt-ah Josef a paipih uh hi.

en: Each one threw down his staff, and it became a snake. But Aaron’s staff swallowed up their staffs.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh a milip in a ciangkhut uh khia suk ciat uh a, tuate gulpi vive a suak hi. Ahih hangin Aaron’ ciangkhut in amau’ ciangkhutte a valhtum hi.

en: So fire came out from the presence of the LORD and consumed them, and they died before the LORD.
zo: Topa’ omna mun panin mei hong paikhia-in amaute kang a, Topa’ mai-ah a si uh hi.

en: Then Moses raised his arm and struck the rock twice with his staff. Water gushed out, and the community and their livestock drank.
zo: Moses in a khut laamto-in a ciangkhut tawh tua suangpi nihvei sat a, tui tampi phulkhia-in mihonte le amau’ ganhingte in a dawn uh hi.

en: Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, yet his eyes were not weak nor his strength gone.
zo: Moses a sihin kum za le kum sawmnih pha hi. A mit maang lo a, a tha ngeina zong kiam lo hi.

en: At that time Joshua imposed this oath: “Cursed before the LORD is the man who rises up and rebuilds this city, Jericho. At the cost of his firstborn he will lay its foundations; at the cost of his youngest he will set up its gates.”
zo: Tua hun laitakin Joshua in amaute tungah thuciamna khat koih a, “Mi khat kipanin hih Jerikho khuapi a lamkik pa in Topa’ mai-ah samsiatna thuak tahen. A tacil luang khaamin tua khuapi bulpi phut ding a, a tapa neupen luang khaamin a kulhkongpite phut ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: The Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he became Israel’s judge. He went to war, and the LORD delivered Cushan-rishathaim king of Aram into his hands.
zo: Topa’ Kha ama tungah tung a, amah, Israel mite’ thukhen a suak hi. Galsim dingin kuankhia a, Topa in ama khut sungah Mesopotamia kumpipa Kushanrishathaim a pia hi.

en: She named the boy Ichabod, saying, “The glory has departed from Israel,” because the ark of God had been captured and because of her father-in-law and her husband.
zo: Tua ciangin amah in, “Israel-te’ sung panin minthanna paikhia khinta!” ci-in a naungek min Ikhabod a phuak hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Pasian’ Thuciamna Singkuang a kimatna hang le a teekpa le a pasal’ hang ahi hi.

en: But David continued up the Mount of Olives, weeping as he went. His head was covered, and he was walking barefoot. And all the people with him covered their heads and went up, weeping as they went.
zo: Ahih hangin Oliv Mual tung kahtohna-ah David paito a, khe guak le lu tuamsa-in a paikawmin kap hi. Amah tawh a om mi khempeuh zong lu khuhsa-in a paitoh kawmun a kap uh hi.

en: When all Israel saw that the king had refused to listen to them, they answered the king: “What share do we have in David, what part in Jesse’s son? To your tents, O Israel! Look after your own house, O David!”
zo: Kumpipa in amau’ thu a ngaih lohna Israel-te khempeuh in a muh uh ciangin mite in kumpipa dawng uh a, “David sungah kote in bang ngah nei ka hi uh hiam? Jessi tapa sungah gamhluah ka nei kei uh hi. Israel-te aw, na inn ciat uhah ciah un. Rehoboam in ama a’ ding vaihawmtawm ta hen,” a ci uh hi. Tua ahih ciangin Israel-te a inn ciat uhah kihem uh hi.

en: He removed the high places, shattered the sacred pillars, and cut down the Asherah poles. He also broke into pieces the bronze snake that Moses had made, for up to that time the Israelites had been burning incense to it.
zo: Amah in mualtung a biaknate hemkhia-in biakna songte sutan a, Asherah milim phukpai hi. Tua ciangin amah in Moses’ bawlsa sumngo gulpi satnen hi; bang hang hiam cih leh tua ni dongin Israel mite in tua tungah paknamtui hal uh hi; tua pen Nehushtan kici hi.

en: But King David replied to Ornan, “No, I insist on paying the full price. I will not take for the LORD what is yours, nor will I offer a burnt offering that costs me nothing.”
zo: Ahih hangin Kumpi David in Ornan kiangah, “Hilo hi, a man a cing tawh kong lei ding hi. Topa a dingin nangma a’ ka la kei ding a, keima sum bei loin meihal biaknate zong ka pia kei ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: But Micaiah said, “As surely as the LORD lives, I will speak only what my God says.”
zo: Ahih hangin Mikaiah in, “ Topa a nungta ahih mah bangin, ka Pasian’ gen thu bek ka gen ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: Thus the work on the house of God in Jerusalem came to a standstill until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
zo: Tua hun a kipanin Jerusalem-a om Pasian’ biakinn a kisepna a khawl hi. Persia kumpi Darias’ uk a kum nihna dong tua bangin a khawlcip phot hi.

en: They refused to listen and failed to remember the wonders You performed among them. They became stiff-necked and in their rebellion appointed a leader to return to their slavery. But You are a forgiving God, gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in love. Therefore You did not forsake them,
zo: Amaute in thu mang nuam lo uh a, amaute lakah na bawl na lamdangte ngaihsun kha lo uh hi. Amaute lungkhauh niloh uh a, a salsuahna uh Egypt-ah a paipih kik dingin makai khat seh uh hi. Ahi zongin nang pen mawhna a maisak nuam, dikin hehpihna a nei, lungduai-in itna kip a nei Pasian na hi a, amaute na nusia tuan kei hi.

en: All the royal officials at the king’s gate bowed down and paid homage to Haman, for the king had commanded this concerning him. But Mordecai would not bow down or pay him homage.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin kumpi huang sunga om kumpipa’ nasem khempeuh in Haman zahtak bawlin ama mai-ah kun uh hi; bang hang hiam cih leh tua banga a hih ding uh kumpipa in thu pia hi. Ahih hangin Mordekai pen amah zahtakna limin a mai-ah kun lo hi.

en: “Man, who is born of woman, is short of days and full of trouble.
zo: “Mihingte a nuntak hun tom mahmah a, lungkhamna tawh kidim hi.

en: My soul finds rest in God alone; my salvation comes from Him.
zo: Dai dide-in Pasian bek ka ngak a, ama hong hotkhiat ding muangin ka om hi.

en: Behold, how good and pleasant it is when brothers dwell together in unity!
zo: En un, sanggamte pumkhat suakin a tut khawm uh ciangin bangzahin hoihin nuam ahi hiam?

en: Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout is a beautiful woman who shows no discretion.
zo: Thu a ngaihsun thei lo numei melhoih pen vokpi muk a om kham nakbah tawh kibang lel hi.

en: Whoever loves money never has money enough; whoever loves wealth is never satisfied with his income. This too is meaningless.
zo: Sum deihna lungsim na neih leh lungkim hun cih na nei ngei kei ding hi. Na hauhnop hangin na deih khempeuh na ngah ngei kei ding hi. Hih pen a mawknapi ahi hi.

en: Many waters cannot quench love; rivers cannot wash it away. If one were to give all the wealth of his house for love, it would be utterly scorned.
zo: Tui tampi nangawn tawh kisumit zo lo a, tui sungah i phumcip hangin mitzo tuan lo hi. Mi khat in a neihsa sum khempeuh tawh itna a lei dingin hong kithawi leh kinuihsan lel ding hi.

en: The ox knows its owner, and the donkey its master’s manger, but Israel does not know; My people do not understand.”
zo: Bawng in amah a nei pa thei a, la in zong a topa’ an piakna mun thei buang hi. Ahih hangin Israel in bangmah thei lo a, keima mite in thei thei lo uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there? Why then has the health of the daughter of my people not been restored?
zo: Gilead-ah zatui om lo ahi hiam? Zato siam om lo ahi hiam? Bang hangin ka mite dam thei lo ahi uh hiam?

en: “Is it nothing to you, all you who pass by? Look and see! Is there any sorrow like my sorrow, which was brought upon me, which the LORD inflicted on the day of His fierce anger?”
zo: A kiim a pamah a pai mi khempeuh kiangah, “Hong en in, kei’ thuak zahin gimna a thuak, Topa in a heh laitakin a hong thuaksak gimna a thuak kei longal, midang kuamah om lo hi,” ci-in a kiko hi.

en: I will make your forehead like the hardest stone, harder than flint. Do not be afraid of them or terrified by them, though they are a rebellious house.”
zo: Suang khempeuh sangin a sakzaw, diamond suang zahin a sakin na lungsim kong bawl ding hi. Tua ahih manin hih a lehdo thei mite kihta kei in,” a hong ci hi.

en: But Daniel resolved not to defile himself with the royal food and wine, and he asked the chief official for permission not to defile himself this way.
zo: Daniel in kumpi innsunga an le leenggahzu tawh a pumpi a thanghuaisak loh nadingin a lungsim a khensat hi. Amah in innsungmang lianpen Ashpenaz kiangah tua bang an a kipiak loh nadingin a ngen zaw hi.

en: And I will betroth you to Me forever; I will betroth you to Me in righteousness and justice, in loving devotion and compassion.
zo: Israel aw, nang, zi-in kong neikik ding a, nang tungah thuman thutangin kong gamta kik ding hi. Nang hong itin kong hehpih tawntung ding a, keima-a’ na hi tawntung ding hi.

en: Blow the trumpet in Zion; sound the alarm on My holy mountain! Let all who live in the land tremble, for the day of the LORD is coming; surely it is near.
zo: Zion mualtungah peengkul tum unla, Pasian’ mual siangtho tungah pataukohna tum un. Topa ni hong naita ahih manin gam sung mi khempeuh lau ta uh hen.

en: “Therefore this is what I will do to you, O Israel, and since I will do this to you, prepare to meet your God, O Israel!”
zo: Tua ahih ciangin Israel mite aw, hih bangin note tungah kong bawl ding hi. Hih bangin hong hih ding ka hih manin Pasian’ thukhenna a thuak dingin kiging un.

en: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You pay tithes of mint, dill, and cumin, but you have neglected the more important matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.
zo: “Mihoih a kineihkhem, no Thukham hilh siate le Farisi mite in gimna na thuak ding uh hi. Note in Pasian tungah lengmasel, masala, le kummin sing namtui a kipanin meh namtui nam khempeuh, sawm-ah-khat pia napi-in, thukham sungah a thupizaw ahi thutang, hehpihna, le thumante na don kei uh hi. Adangte nusia tuan loin hih thute na zuih ding uh ahi hi.

en: For they all gave out of their wealth; but she, out of her poverty, put in everything—all she had to live on.”
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh adangte in a neihval a lamval sung panun a khia uh ahi hi; ahi zongin amah zawng mahmah napi-in ama kivak nading nangawn siit loin a neih khempeuh a khiakhin ahi hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then He said to them all, “If anyone wants to come after Me, he must deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow Me.
zo: Tua ciangin Jesuh in a nungzuite le mi khempeuh kiangah, “Mi khatpeuh in kei hong zuihnop leh ama deihna bangin gamta nawn loin nisimin a singlamteh pua-in hong zui ding hi.

en: Jesus wept.
zo: Tua ciangin Jesuh zong a kap hi.

en: Then Agrippa said to Paul, “Do you think that in such a short time you can persuade me to be a Christian?”
