zo: Ahi zongin thu na nget uh ciangin na innsung uhah tumin kong khak unla, na muh theih loh uh na Pa uh kiangah na ngen un. Tua hileh kuama muh lohin na gamtatna uh a hong mu na Pa un note’ tungah thaman hong pia ding hi.

en: And wherever He went—into villages, towns, or countryside—they laid the sick in the marketplaces and begged Him to let them touch even the tassel of His cloak. And all who touched Him were healed.
zo: Khuapi, khuaneu, le khuakehte a a paina khempeuhah, mite in mihon kikhopna munah cinate hong pua uh a, a puanmongteep beek a lawnsak nading deihin Jesuh kiangah a thum uh hi. A puanmongteep a lawngkha mi khempeuh cidam pahpah uh hi.

en: He replied, “Whether He is a sinner I do not know. One thing I do know: I was blind, but now I see!”
zo: “Amah a gamta khial ahihleh ahihloh bangmah ka thei kei hi. Keima theih thu in: Nidangin a mittaw kimlai, tu-in khua ka mukik theita hi,” ci-in a dawng hi.

en: While they were stoning him, Stephen prayed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
zo: Tua bangin suang a khiat thuahthuah laitakun Stefen in thu ngen a, “Topa Jesuh aw, ka kha hong la in,” a ci hi.

en: The Spirit clearly says that in later times some will abandon the faith and follow deceiving spirits and things taught by demons.
zo: Nidang ciangin a upna panun mi pawlkhat pialin, zuauthu gente le dawi thu a kigente a zuih nading uh Kha Siangtho in teltakin a gen hi.

en: But there were also false prophets among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you. They will secretly introduce destructive heresies, even denying the Master who bought them—bringing swift destruction on themselves.
zo: Mite lakah kamsang man lo a omngei mah bangin note lakah sia man lo hong om ding hi. Siatna a piangsak thei thuhilhna a man lo hong lutpih simin, amaute mahmah a tankhia Topa nangawn nial ding uh hi. Tua ahih manin thakhat thu-in siatna thuaklawh ding uh hi.

en: Beloved, although I was very eager to write to you about our common salvation, I found it necessary to write to you urging you to contend for the faith that was once for all entrusted to the saints.
zo: Ka itte aw, eite in i ngahkhawm hotkhiatna thu, note kiangah gelh nuam mahmahin ka om laitakin Pasian in ama mite tungah a tawntungin a kimang dingin khatvei bek a hong piak upna thu-ah note in na nawksuak nadingun hanthotna gelh ding a kisapna thu ka phawk hi.

en: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.
zo: Peengkul nunung hong gin’ ciangin mitphiat kikal sungin i kikhelpak ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh peengkul hong gin’ ciangin misite a sithei nawn lo dingin hong tho ding a, i vekpi-in i kikheel ding hi.

en: Blessed and holy are those who share in the first resurrection. The second death has no power over them, but they will be priests of God and of Christ, and will reign with Him for a thousand years.
zo: Hih thawhkikna masa sungah a kihel mite pen Pasian’ mi siangtho hi a, a hampha mahmah ahi uh hi. Nihvei sihna in tua bang mite bangmah cihzo nawn lo ding a, amaute pen Pasian le Khrih’ siampite hi ding uh a, amah tawh kum tulkhat sung ukna aana nei ding uh hi.

en: For at that time there will be great tribulation, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now, and never to be equaled again.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh leitung piancil a kipan tuhun dong, cikmahin tua bang haksatna a om ngei lo, nidang ciangin zong a om ngei nawn lo ding, tua hun laitakin hong tung ding hi.

en: Let no one deceive you in any way, for that day will not come until the rebellion occurs and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the man doomed to destruction.
zo: Ahi zongin kuama khemsa-in ta kei un. Bang hang hiam cih leh nakpitakin Pasian langpanna lianpi le hell khuksung a tung ding ahi A Gilopa hong kilat matengin tua Ni hong tung lo ding hi.

en: He who testifies to these things says, “Yes, I am coming soon.” Amen. Come, Lord Jesus!
zo: Hih thu khempeuh hong genin teci a pang mipa in, “Ka hong pai baih taktak ding hi,” hong ci hi. Na cih bangin hi ta peuh hen. Topa Jesuh aw, hong pai ta in!

en: And those He predestined, He also called; those He called, He also justified; those He justified, He also glorified.
zo: Tua ahih manin ama sap mite a sehsa hi a, a sap mite amah tawh a kipawlin bawl a, amah tawh a kipawlin a bawl mite ama minthanna zong a hawm hi.

en: But if serving the LORD seems undesirable to you, then choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve, whether the gods your fathers served beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you are living. But as for me and my household, we will serve the LORD.”
zo: Topa’ na na sepnop kei uhleh, Gun galkhat a a na na sepsak uh na pu na pate uh pasian ahi a, note’ tenna gam Amor mite’ pasian ahi zongin, a na na sepsak ding peuhpeuh uh tuni-in teel un. Ahih hangin kei le ka innkuanpihte in ahihleh Topa’ na ka sem ding uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: Above all, you must understand that no prophecy of Scripture comes from one’s own interpretation.
zo: Na phawk ding uh a thupi mahmah khat in: Lai Siangtho sunga om thugen kholhnate, kuamah in ama pilna tawh a khiatna gen thei lo hi.

en: The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of His hands.
zo: Vantung in Pasian’ minthanna gen a, vanpi in ama nasepna taangko hi.

en: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
zo: Topa zahtakna in pilna kipatna hi a, mihaite in pilna le thuhilhna don lo uh hi.

en: “For My thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways My ways,” declares the LORD.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh keima ngaihsutnate nomau’ ngaihsutna bang hi lo a, keima paiziate nomau’ paizia bang hi lo hi, Topa in ci hi.

en: And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’
zo: Na Topa Pasian uh, na lungsim khempeuh, na nuntakna khempeuh, na pilna khempeuh, le na thahatna khempeuh uh tawh na it un, a cihna ahi hi.

en: Do to others as you would have them do to you.
zo: Note tungah a hong kibawl ding na deih uh bangin midangte tungah na bawl un.

en: Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.
zo: Lawmte’ tang ding sih ngamna sangin lawmte itna a lianzaw om nawn lo hi.

en: ‘For in Him we live and move and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘We are His offspring.’
zo: Mi khat in, ‘Pasian hangin eite piangin, hingin i gamtang hi,’ ci-in gen a, note sung panin laphuah siampa khat in zong, ‘Eite zong ama tate ihi hi,’ na na ci hi.

en: Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own;
zo: Na pumpi uh, Pasian in a hong piak, note’ sungah a teng Kha Siangtho’ biakinn ahih lamtak thei lo na hi uh hiam? Note’ pumpi, nomau’ neihsa hi lo a, Pasian a’ ahi hi.

en: There is neither Jew nor Greek, slave nor free, male nor female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
zo: Tua ahih manin Jew mi le Gentail mi, sila le sila ahi lo, numei le pasal cih bangin kideidanna om nawn lo a, note khempeuh Khrih tawh na kipawlna hangun pawlkhat hi-in, a kibangkim na hi uh hi.

en: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave Himself up for her
zo: Pasalte aw, Khrih in pawlpi itin a pumpi a piak mah bangin na zite uh na it un.

en: Do nothing out of selfish ambition or empty conceit, but in humility consider others more important than yourselves.
zo: Huaihamna lungsim le kisialh nopna lungsim tawh bangmah gamta kei un. Kiniamkhiat ciat unla, midangte thupi ngaihsutzaw un.

en: Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,
zo: Mite’ nasem bangin kingaihsun loin, Pasian’ nasem bangin kingaihsun unla, na sep peuhpeuh uh lungsim takpi tawh lawpin sem un.

en: For there is one God and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus,
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh Pasian khat bek om a, Pasian le mite a hong kilemsakkik thei Khrih Jesuh khat bek om hi.

en: Just as man is appointed to die once, and after that to face judgment,
zo: Mi khempeuh khatvei si-in, tua khit ciangin Pasian’ thukhenna a thuak ding ahih mah bangin,

en: Be doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves.
zo: Nomau kikhem tawmin thu zak bek tawh maisak kei unla, na zak bangun zui-in semzaw un.

en: But in your hearts sanctify Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect,
zo: Na lungsim sung uhah Khrih zahtakbawl unla, amah Topa-in nei un. Note’ lametna thu a hong dong a omkhak leh hoihtakin a genthei dingin kiging tawntung unla, ahi zongin lungnemna le zahtakna lim tawh gen un.

en: If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
zo: Ahi zongin Pasian kiangah i mawhnate va pulak lehang, amah citakin thuman ahih manin, i mawhnate hong maisakin i hoih lohnate khempeuh hong siangsak ding hi.

en: “You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for You created all things, and by Your will they were created and have their being.”
zo: “Kote’ Topa Pasian aw, nangmah in na khempeuh piangsakin, nangma deihna bangin na khempeuh omin, na khempeuh kipiangsak ahih manin, minthanna, pahtawina, le vangliatna na ngah tawntung dingin a kilawm hi,” a ci uh hi.

en: Now the LORD said to Abram, “Go from your country, your people, and your father’s household to the land I will show you.
zo: Topa in Abram kiangah, “Na gam, na beh, le na pa’ inn panin nang kong lah ding gamah pai in.

en: The LORD will fight for you; you need only to be still.”
zo: Topa in note a dingin hong dosak ding a, note ahihleh na om hithiat ding uh hi bek hi,” a ci hi.

en: Do not seek revenge or bear a grudge against any of your people, but love your neighbor as yourself. I am the LORD.
zo: Note in nomau’ mipihte tungah phu la loin, amau na lungsim neih kei ding uh a, nomau na ki-it uh bangin na vengte uh na it ding uh hi; kei pen Topa ka hi hi.

en: God is not a man, that He should lie, nor a son of man, that He should change His mind. Does He speak and then not act? Does He promise and not fulfill?
zo: A zuau dingin Pasian pen mihing hi lo a, a kisik dingin mihing’ tapa hi lo hi. Amah in gen khin hi; a gen bangin hih lo ding ahi hiam? Amah in ci khin hi; a cih bangin tungsak lo ding ahi hiam?

en: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one.
zo: “Israel-te aw, za un: Topa i Pasian, Topa khat bek ahi hi.

en: This Book of the Law must not depart from your mouth; meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. For then you will prosper and succeed.
zo: Hih thukham laibu na mangngilh ngei kei ding hi. A sunga kigelh thute khempeuh tawh kizui-in na gamtat theih nadingin sunlezanin na lungngaingai ding hi. Tua hileh na maa vang ding a, na nasep tangtung ding hi.

en: May the LORD repay your work, and may you be richly rewarded by the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to take refuge.”
zo: Topa in na gamtatnasate a pha tawh hong thuk a, a liimnuai beel dinga na paina Israel-te’ Pasian, Topa in thaman a cingin hong pia ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: But Samuel replied, “Does the LORD delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices as much as in obeying the voice of the LORD? Behold, obedience is better than sacrifice, and attentiveness is better than the fat of rams.
zo: Tua ciangin Samuel in, “ Topa in meihal biaknate le biakpiaknate Topa’ thu man’ ding zahin deih ahi hiam? En in, biakpiakna sangin thu man’ ding hoihzaw a, tuutal thaute sangin thu ngaih ding hoihzaw hi.

en: As for God, His way is perfect; the word of the LORD is flawless. He is a shield to all who take refuge in Him.
zo: “Hih Pasian a thu kicing a, Topa’ kamciamna a manna kilang hi. Amah a beelte khempeuh a dingin kidalna lum ahi hi.

en: “But will God indeed dwell on earth? Behold, the heavens, even the highest heavens, cannot contain You; how much less this temple I have built!
zo: “Ahih hangin leitungah Pasian teng taktak ding ahi hiam? Vantung le vantung a sangpen in nang hong huam zo lo hi. Tua ahih manin keima lamsa hih biakinn in bangzahin nang hong huam zo lo zaw kan ding ahi hiam?

en: Then Joseph remembered his dreams about them and said to them, “You are spies! You have come to see where our land is unprotected.”
zo: Josef in a mangin amaute a mat khitna a phawk hi. Amah in amaute kiangah, “Note, thukan na hi uh a, hih gam thaneemna a en dingin hong pai na hi uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
zo: mit tang ding mit, ha tang ding ha, khut tang ding khut, khe tang ding khe,

en: The goat will carry on itself all their iniquities to a solitary place, and the man shall release it in the wilderness.
zo: Keel in amau’ mawhnate khempeuh pua-in gam daihna-ah a pai dingin a keel khah ding hi.

en: But Balaam said to Balak, “See, I have come to you. But can I say just anything? I must speak only the word that God puts in my mouth.”
zo: Balaam in Balak kiangah, “En in, na kiang hong tung ing! Thu khatpeuh ka gen theih nading vangliatna nei ka hi hiam? Pasian in hong sawl thu bek ka gen ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: It is to be with him, and he is to read it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to revere the LORD his God and follow carefully all the words of this law and these decrees
zo: Hih thukham sunga thute le hih ngeinate kemin zuihna tawh Topa a Pasian zahtak ding a theih nading, a mipihte tungah ama lungsim a kiliatsak loh nading, thupiaknate them khat zong a pelh loh nading, le Israel-te sung ahi ama kumpi gam sungah amah le a tate saupi a om theih nadingin amah in a nuntak sung tawntung tua sunga thute sim ding hi.

en: Then Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two spies from Shittim. “Go, look over the land,” he said, “especially Jericho.” So they went and entered the house of a prostitute named Rahab and stayed there.
zo: Tua ciangin Nun’ tapa Joshua in Shittim panin thukanin mi nih sawlsim a, “Pai-in gam va en unla, a diakdiakin Jerikho khua hong en un,” a ci hi. Amaute pai uh a, Rahab min nei a paktat numei khat’ inn-ah tungin giak uh hi.

en: “I will certainly go with you,” said Deborah. “But because of the way you are going about this, the honor will not be yours, for the LORD will deliver Sisera into the hands of a woman.”
zo: Tua ciangin amah in, “Nang tawh kong kuan taktak ding hi. Ahi zongin gualzawhna pen nangma min than nading hi lo ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa in numei khat’ khut sungah Sisera pia ding hi,” a ci hi. Tua ciangin Deborah dingin Barak tawh Kedesh-ah pai hi.

en: Samuel said to Saul, “Why have you disturbed me by bringing me up?” “I am in great distress,” Saul said. “The Philistines are fighting against me, and God has turned away from me. He no longer answers me, either by prophets or by dreams. So I have called on you to tell me what to do.”
zo: Tua ciangin Samuel in Saul kiangah, “Bang hangin keimah saptohna tawh hong nawngkaisak na hi hiam?” a ci hi. Saul in dawngin, “Nakpi takin ka lungkham hi; Filistia-te in kei hong sim a, kei kiang panin Pasian kiheikhia-in kamsangte tawh ahi a, mang tawh ahi zongin hong dawng nawn lo hi. Tua ahih ciangin ka gamtat nading zia a hong gen dingin nang kong sam hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then Nathan said to David, “You are the man! This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I anointed you king over Israel, and I delivered you from the hand of Saul.
zo: Tua ciangin Nathan in David kiangah, “Nang pen tua mipa na hi hi. Israel Pasian, Topa in hih bangin ci hi: ‘Israel-te tungah kumpi-in nang sathau hong nilhin Saul’ khutsung panin nang kong honkhia hi.

en: When King Jeroboam heard the word that the man of God cried out against the altar at Bethel, he stretched out his hand from the altar and said, “Seize him!” But the hand he stretched out toward the man shriveled up, so that he could not pull it back.
zo: Bethel-a biakna tau langpangin Pasian’ mipa’ thugenna kumpipa in a zak ciangin biakna tau panin Jeroboam in a khut zan a, “Amah lencip un,” a ci hi. Tua ciangin amah langpangin a zankhiat a khut keucip ahih manin a khut tonsakkik thei nawn lo hi.

en: In those days Hezekiah became ill and was at the point of death. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz went to him and said, “This is what the LORD says: Put your house in order, because you are going to die; you will not recover.”
zo: Tua hun laitakin Hezekiah cina-in si dektak hi. Tua ciangin Amoz’ tapa kamsang Isaiah hong pai-in ama kiangah, “ Topa in hih bangin ci hi: ‘Na innkuan vai ding hawm in; bang hang hiam cih leh nang na si ding hi; na damkikzo kei ding hi,’ ci hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
zo: Satan in Israel mite gimsak nuam ahih manin Israel mi phazah a sim dingin David hanthawn hi.

en: But when envoys were sent by the rulers of Babylon to ask him about the miraculous sign that had occurred in the land, God left him to test him and to know everything that was in his heart.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin gam sung omzia lim a kan dingin ama kiangah a kisawl Babylon uliante’ kamtaite tawh kisai-in, amah a ze-etna ding le ama lungsim sungah bang om hiam cih a vekpi-in a theih nadingin Pasian in ama thu-in amah a omsak hi.

en: And you, Ezra, in accordance with the wisdom of your God, which you possess, are to appoint magistrates and judges to administer justice for all the people of Trans-Euphrates—all who know the laws of your God. And you are to teach any who do not know them.
zo: “Tua hi a, nang Ezra in nang tungah hong kipia na Pasian’ pilna tawh kizui-in Eufratis Gungal gam sunga mite thu a khen dingin na Pasian’ thukham a thei mite seh in. Nang le amaute in na Pasian’ thukham a thei lote na hilh ding uh hi.

en: When I heard these things, I sat down and wept. For some days I mourned and fasted and prayed before the God of heaven.
zo: Hih thu ka zak ciangin tusukin ka kap niloh a, ni tampi sung an tangin, vantung Pasian kiangah thu ka ngen hi.

en: When Mordecai learned of all that had been done, he tore his clothes, put on sackcloth and ashes, and went out into the city, wailing loudly and bitterly.
zo: Mordekai in hih thupiang teng a theih ciangin a puan balkekin puanhampi silhin vut kibuak a, nakpitakin a kap kawmin khua sungah vak kawikawi hi.

en: So Satan went out from the presence of the LORD and afflicted Job with painful sores from the soles of his feet to the crown of his head.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin Topa’ omna panin Satan paikhia a, Job a khetul pan a luzang dongin a kihhuai meima a veisak hi.

en: In peace I will lie down and sleep, for You alone, O LORD, make me dwell in safety.
zo: Nuamtakin lumin ka ihmu ta ding hi; bang hang hiam cih leh Topa aw, nangmah bek in lungmuanna munah na hong omsak hi.

en: He split the rocks in the wilderness and gave them water as abundant as the seas;
zo: Amah in gam sungah suangpite kitamsak a, tuithukpi sung panin a piangkhia bangin amaute’ tungah tui dawn ding tampi a pia hi.

en: “The LORD possessed me at the beginning of His work, before His deeds of old.
zo: “ Topa in kei hong piangsak masa pen a, tangtawnga ama sep lak pan a masa pen ka hi hi.

en: If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat; if he is thirsty, give him water to drink.
zo: Na galte a gil a kial leh an pia inla, a dang a tak leh tui pia in.

en: A good name is better than fine perfume, and the day of death better than the day of birth.
zo: A manpha paknamtui sangin minpha hoihzaw a, i suah ni sangin i sih ni hoihzaw hi.

en: Learn to do right; seek justice. Defend the oppressed. Take up the cause of the fatherless; plead the case of the widow.
zo: Gamtat hoih ding kisin un. Thumanin gamta unla, kinetniamna kheel un. Pa nei lote hu unla, meigong numei panpih un,” ci hi.

en: This is what the LORD says: “A voice is heard in Ramah, mourning and great weeping, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.”
zo: Topa in kong cihin-ah: “Ramah khua-ah aw khat kiza a, tauna le kah ngutngutna awging ahi hi. Rachel, a tate a dingin a kap hi. A tate om nawn lo ahih manin kinem zo lo hi,” a ci hi.

en: And I went to the exiles at Tel-abib who lived by the Kebar River. And there, where they were living, I sat among them for seven days, overwhelmed.
zo: Tua ahih manin ka mipih salte’ omna, Khebar Gun gei-a a om Telabib munah ka va tung a, ka muhsa thute ngaihsunin tua lai-a amaute lakah ni sagih sung ka om hi.

en: Suddenly the fingers of a human hand appeared and wrote on the plaster of the wall, near the lampstand in the royal palace. The king watched the hand as it wrote.
zo: Thakhat thu-in kumpi innsung meivak a taan penna lam kawm tungah mihing khut khat hong kilangin lai a hong gelh hi. Tua khut in lai a gelh laitak kumpipa in a mu hi.

en: When they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. “Get up,” he said, “take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to search for the child to kill him.”
zo: Tua mipilte a ciah khit uh ciangin Josef’ mang sungah Topa’ vantungmi khat hong kilang a, “Kithawi-in naungek le a nu, Egypt gamah taipih in. Pai khia un, ci-in kong genkik matengin tua gamah va om un. Herod in naungek thah dingin hong zong ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” “My name is Legion,” he replied, “for we are many.”
zo: Jesuh in, “Na min bang ahi hiam?” ci-in a dong hi. Mipa in, “Kote tampi pha ka hih manun ka min pen A Honpi ahi hi,” ci-in a dawng hi.

en: But a Samaritan, as he traveled, came where the man was; and when he saw him, he took pity on him.
zo: Ahi zongin Samaria mi khualzin khat, tua lai mun hong tungin a liam pa a muh ciangin hehpihhuaisa a,

en: “Nazareth! Can anything good come from there?” Nathanael asked. “Come and see,” said Philip.
zo: Nethanel in, “Nazareth khua panin bang hong piang peuhmah ding ahi hiam?” na cihsan hi. Ahi zongin Filip in, “Hong pai inla, hong mu dih in,” a ci hi.

en: When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.
zo: Pentekos ni hong tun ciangin Jesuh a um mi khempeuh mun khatah kikhawm uh hi.

en: The wrath of God is being revealed from heaven against all the godlessness and wickedness of men who suppress the truth by their wickedness,
zo: Mihingte in a mawhna le a gitlohna hangun Pasian’ thuman seelcip uh ahih manin van panin a hehna hong kilang sakin a gimpiakna dingzia hong kilangsak hi.

en: What I mean is this: One of you says, “I follow Paul”; another, “I follow Apollos”; another, “I follow Cephas”; still another, “I follow Christ.”
zo: Tua bang ka cih ciangin note pawlkhat in, “Kei, Paul’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi a, pawlkhat in, “Kei, Apollos’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi a, pawlkhat in, “Kei, Peter’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi a, pawlkhat in, “Kei, Khrih’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi zongin na kampaunate uh ka cihna ahi hi.

en: And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light.
zo: Tua pen lamdangsak ding hi lo hi. Satan nangawn Pasian’ vantungmi tawh a kibangin kibawltawm thei hi.

en: When Peter came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he was clearly in the wrong.
zo: Antiok khua-ah Peter hong hawh sungin a gamtat khialhna hangin thu uppih mite lak mahah amah ka taii hi.

en: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which He has called you, the riches of His glorious inheritance in the saints,
zo: Note bang dingin hong sam a, a mite tungah a hong ciam thupha lamdangte bangzah takin lian a, thu um ahi eite sungah na a hong sem vangliatna bangzah takin lian ahi hiam, cih na muhtheih nadingun note’ lungsim mit hong vaksak nadingin thu ka na ngen hi. Eite sungah na a hong sem vangliatna pen sihna panin Khrih hingsakin, vantung gamah zong, ama taklamah a tutsak nadingin a zat vangliatna mah ahi hi.

en: And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
zo: Mihingte in a theihtel zawh loh Pasian’ hong piak lungsim nopna in, Khrih Jesuh tawh na kipawlna uh hangin note hong lungnuamsak ding hi.

en: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation.
zo: Khrih pen a kimu thei lo Pasian’ lim hi a, a kipiangsak khempeuh lakah tapa upa pen ahi hi.

en: Brothers, we do not want you to be ignorant about those who fall asleep, or to grieve like the rest of men, who have no hope.
zo: Sanggamte aw, lametna a nei lo mite bangin na dahluat loh nadingun a sisa mite’ omzia ding thu na theih ding uh ka deih hi.

en: We hear that some among you are idle. They are not busy; they are busybodies.
zo: Hih bangin thu ka hong genna uh pen note lakah mi pawlkhatte thadahin na sem nuam lo uh a, midangte’ nasepna va nawngkaisak zawsop hi, ci-in ka zakna hang uh ahi hi.

en: He must not be a recent convert, or he may become conceited and fall under the same judgment as the devil.
zo: Khristian a suaktungte zong hi lo ding hi. Tua bang mi thakte kiphasak thei a, Dawimangpa mah bangin thukhenna a thuak mite hikha thei ding hi.

en: Nevertheless, God’s solid foundation stands firm, sealed with this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are His,” and, “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.”
zo: Ahi zongin Pasian in a phuhsa sutpi kilokzo ngei lo ding hi. Tua sutpi tungah, “Topa in ama mi kua teng hiam cih thei hi,” cihna le, “Topa tawh kipawl ing, a ci peuhmah in mawhna sukhalo ding hi,” cihna kigelh hi.

en: Warn a divisive person once, and then warn him a second time. After that, have nothing to do with him.
zo: Kitot, kikhen nading a piangsak mite pen khatvei nihvei bang na hilh khit ciangin kisukha nawn vet kei in.

en: Therefore, since the promise of entering His rest still stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.
zo: Ahi zongin tu-in eite va pai-in amah tawh i tawlngak khawm theih nadingin Pasian in thuciam hong nusiat khin ahih manin tua tawlngakna munah a lutlah na suahkhak loh nadingun lau-in kidawm ni.

en: My brothers, as believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ, do not show favoritism.
zo: Sanggamte aw, minthanna vang tawh a kidim i Topa Jesuh Khrih umin na om laitakun a pualama kilang pianziate siksanin mi na deidan kei un.

en: For you know that it was not with perishable things such as silver or gold that you were redeemed from the empty way of life you inherited from your forefathers,
zo: Na pu na pate uh nuntakzia, bangmahin a kimang lo nuntakna panin a hong suahtaksak nadingin Pasian in note’ man dingin a piak pen a man a kiam thei ngun le khamte bang hi lo a,

en: He writes this way in all his letters, speaking in them of these matters. Some of his comments are hard to understand, which ignorant and unstable people distort, as they do the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.
zo: Lai a hong gelhna sungah a thugente tu-ate mah a gennuam ahi hi. A laigelhna sungah a telhak thu tampi om a, theihna kicing loin lungsim kip lo mi pawlkhatte in Lai Siangtho sung thu a ututun a kawihei uh bangin Paul’ thugente zong a man lopi-in khia uh ahih manin siatna a tuaklawh uh hi.

en: If anyone has material possessions and sees his brother in need but has no pity on him, how can the love of God be in him?
zo: Mi khat hau mahmah hen la, a Khristian mipih a cimawhte mu napi-in huhna bangmah pianuam hetkei leh, bang hangin amah in Pasian ka it hi, ci thei ding ahi hiam?

en: I looked, and there before me was a pale horse! Its rider was named Death, and Hades was following close behind him. They were given power over a fourth of the earth to kill by sword, famine, and plague, and by the wild beasts of the earth.
zo: Ka khuadak leh sakol puang khat ka mu a, a tungah a tuang pa’ min pen Sihna hi a, a nungah Hell in a zui hi. Amaute in namsau, kialpi, pulnatna, le gamsate tawh leitung mi sehlisuah sehkhat a thahtheih nadingun thu a kipia hi.

en: And he cried out in a mighty voice: “Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great! She has become a dwelling for demons and a haunt for every unclean spirit, a haunt for every unclean and detestable bird.
zo: Amah nakpitakin kiko a, “A Lian Babylon khuapi kicim, kicim! Tu-in dawite’ kua suak khinta-in, kha gilote’ omna suak khinta a, a kihhuai, a muhdahhuai vasa namkim in omna-in neita uh hi.

en: That is why it was called Babel, because there the LORD confused the language of the whole world. From there the LORD scattered them over the face of the whole earth.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin a min Babel kici hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa in tua munah leitung khempeuh’ kampau kitukalhsak hi. Tua lai mun panin Topa in leitung khempeuhah amaute a thehthang hi.

en: “Who among the gods is like You, O LORD? Who is like You—majestic in holiness, awesome in glory, working wonders?
zo: “ Topa aw, pasian-te’ lakah kua, nang tawh kibang ahi hiam? Kua, nang tawh kibangin, sianthona-ah lianin, minthang nasepna-ah kihtakhuai-in, nalamdang sem ahi hiam?

en: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD, and He delights in his way.
zo: Topa in mi a lam pai nading lak a, ama lungkim bangin a gamta pa amah in a kipsak hi.

en: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who wins souls is wise.
zo: Midikte a khansau a, migilote khansih hi.

en: I have swept away your transgressions like a cloud, your sins like the morning mist. Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.”
zo: Na thupalsatnate meiipi bangin na khialhnate meiilum bangin ka phiatkhia khinzo hi. Hong honkhia khin ka hih manin kei kiangah hong ciahkik in.

en: “Behold, the days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and He will reign as King and act wisely and administer justice and righteousness in the land.
zo: “En un, Topa in kong cihin-ah, keimah in David’ suan lak panin kumpi dingin a diktat mi khat ka khankhiatsak ni hong tung ding hi. Amah gam uk siam mahmah ding a, gam sungah thuman thutang tawh thu hong khen ding hi.

en: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field. When a man found it, he hid it again, and in his joy he went and sold all he had and bought that field.
zo: “Vantung ki-ukna pen lolai-ah a kiseel sum tawh kibang hi. Mi khat in a muh ciangin limtakin a seelpha hi. Amah lungdam mahmahin a inn-ah ciahpah a, a neih khempeuh a zuak khit ciangin tua lo a lei hi.

en: Jesus called out with a loud voice, “Father, into Your hands I commit My spirit.” And when He had said this, He breathed His last.
zo: Tua ciangin nakpitakin Jesuh kiko a, “Pa aw, nangma khut sungah keimah kong ki-ap hi,” a cih khit ciangin a si ta hi.

en: Jesus replied, “Truly, truly, I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God unless he is born again.”
zo: Jesuh in, “A mantakin kong genin-ah, mi khatpeuh a suahkik kei leh Pasian’ Ukna sungah lut thei lo ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: And He is not served by human hands, as if He needed anything, because He Himself gives all men life and breath and everything else.
zo: Amah pen mi khempeuh tungah nuntakna le na khempeuh a piapa ahih manin mihingte in ama a dingin na khat peuhpeuh a sepsak ding a kisam ahi kei hi.

en: No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us.
zo: Eite a hong it pa’ hangin hih thu khempeuhah a gualzo pente ihi hi.

en: “Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?”
zo: Sihna aw, na gualzawhna koi-ah om a, midangte na suksiat zawh nading na thahatna koi-ah omta ahi hiam?” na ci hi.

en: If you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.
zo: Khrih tawh na kipawl nak-uhleh Abraham’ suante na hita uh a, Pasian’ hong khap thute a ngah ding na hi uh hi.

en: As for you, you were dead in your transgressions and sins,
zo: A beisa hunah na thuman lohna uh le na mawhna uh hangin kha thu tawh kisai-ah a si na hi uh hi.

en: And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to death—even death on a cross!
zo: Amah hong kiniamkhiat tawm a, singlamteh tung nangawnah sih ding a ut hi.

en: But now He has reconciled you by Christ’s physical body through death to present you holy, unblemished, and blameless in His presence—
zo: Ahi zongin, a Tapa a pumpi mahmahin a hong sihna hangin note, a cidam, a siangtho, paubaanna om hetloin ama kiangah hong laktheih nadingin Pasian in note ama lawmin a hong bawl khinta ahi hi.

en: who gave Himself as a ransom for all—the testimony given in its proper time.
zo: Mi khempeuh a tankhia dingin tua Jesuh hong kipiatawm a, a hun lian laitakin a hong kipiakna pen Pasian in mi khempeuh a hotkhiat nopna thu a kilatna ahi hi.

en: so also Christ was offered once to bear the sins of many; and He will appear a second time, not to bear sin, but to bring salvation to those who are eagerly waiting for Him.
zo: mi tampite’ mawhna a thuak dingin Khrih zong khatvei bek a kipia hi. A nihveina hong kilatkik ciangin mawhna thu tawh kisai nasem ding hi nawn loin, lawptakin amah a ngak mite a honkhia ding ahi hi.

en: In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin gamtatna in a zui lo upna guak pen a si ahi hi.

en: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! By His great mercy He has given us new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
zo: I Topa Jesuh Khrih’ Pa Pasian tungah lungdam ni. Ama hong hehpih mahmahna hangin sihna panin Jesuh Khrih a thawhkik sakna tawh eite tungah nuntakna thak a hong pia hi. Tua ahih manin i lametna kiam ngei lo a,

en: All inhabitants of the earth will worship the beast—all whose names have not been written in the book of life belonging to the Lamb that was slain from the foundation of the world.
zo: Tua ahih manin a kigo Tuuno laibu sungah a nungta ding mite’ min, leitung pianma pekin a kikhumna-ah a kihel lo leitung mi khempeuh in tua ganhing bia ding uh hi.

en: I did not see a temple in the city, because the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.
zo: A Vanglian Topa Pasian le Tuuno pen khuapi biakinn hita ahih manin tua khua sungah biakinn dang ka mu kei hi.

en: Then Jacob gave Esau some bread and some lentil stew. He ate and drank, and then got up and left. So Esau despised his birthright.
zo: Tua ciangin Jakob in an le bemeh Esau a pia hi. Esau in zong an ne-in tui a dawn khit ciangin a pai nading a zuan hi. Tua ahih manin Esau in a innluahza tua ciang bang bekin a ngaihsun ahi hi.

en: “It is the finger of God,” the magicians said to Pharaoh. But Pharaoh’s heart was hard, and he would not listen, just as the LORD had said.
zo: Mitphial siamte in Faro’ kiangah, “Hih pen Pasian’ nasepna ahi hi,” ci uh hi. Ahih hangin Faro’ lungsim khauh a, Topa’ gensa bangin amah in amaute’ thu ngai lo hi.

en: You are to season each of your grain offerings with salt. You must not leave the salt of the covenant of your God out of your grain offerings. You are to offer salt with all your offerings.
zo: An tawh na biaknate khempeuh ci na sawh ding hi. An tawh na biakna-ah na Pasian tawh na thuciamna ci sawh loin na om kei ding a, na biakna khempeuh ci na sawh ding hi.

en: But because My servant Caleb has a different spirit and follows Me wholeheartedly, I will bring him into the land he has entered, and his descendants will inherit it.
zo: Ahih hangin ka nasem Kaleb ahihleh, amah in lungsim tuam nei-in limtakin kei hong zui ahih manin, amah in a zuat leitangah ka tunpih ding a, ama suanlekhakte in tua leitang luah ding uh hi.

en: Acknowledge and take to heart this day that the LORD is God in heaven above and on the earth below. There is no other.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin tunga om vantung hitaleh nuai-a om leitung hitaleh ah Topa pen Pasian ahihna thu tuni-in thei unla, na lungsim uhah ciamteh un; kuamah dang om lo hi.

en: Over Achan they heaped up a large pile of rocks, which remains to this day. Then the LORD turned from His fierce anger. Therefore that place has been called the Valley of Achor to this day.
zo: Tua ciangin amaute in tuni donga a om suang honpi ama tungah a ciang uh hi. Tua ciangin Topa’ hehluatna a dai hi. Tua ahih ciangin tu dongin tua mun pen Akhor Kuam, kici hi.

en: for you will conceive and give birth to a son. No razor may be used on his head, because the boy is to be a Nazirite, dedicated to God from the womb. He will begin the deliverance of Israel from the hands of the Philistines.”
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh nang gai-in tapa khat na nei ding hi. Ama lu tungah mulkiatna kitah lo ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh naupang pen a suah a kipanin Pasian’ tungah Nazir mi hi ding a, amah in Filistia mite’ khutsung panin Israel-te hotkhiat ding kipan ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: The LORD sends poverty and wealth; He humbles and He exalts.
zo: Topa in zawngsakin hausak a, amah in niamkhiat sukin, zong sangtosak hi.

en: I will become even more undignified than this, and I will be humiliated in my own eyes. But by these slave girls you have mentioned, I will be held in honor.”
zo: Hih sangin a simmawhhuai zaw-in ka kibawl lai ding a, nangma mit bekah a ginalo ka hi ding hi. Ahih hangin nangma gen numeite in keimah hong pahtawi ding uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: At noon Elijah began to taunt them. “Shout louder!” he said. “Surely he is a god! Perhaps he is deep in thought, or busy, or traveling. Maybe he is sleeping and must be awakened.”
zo: Sun ciangin Elijah in amaute zahpihin, “Amah pen pasian ahih ciangin a gingin kiko un. Amah in thu a lungngaih laitak, ahih kei leh mun dangah paikhia, ahih kei leh khualzin, ahih kei leh amah ihmu-in phot ding kisam hikhathei ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then Elijah took his cloak, rolled it up, and struck the water. The water divided to the right and to the left, and the two of them crossed over on dry ground.
zo: Tua ciangin Elijah in a puantualpi suahin zial a, tua tawh a tui sat hi. Lei keu tungah amau tegel a pai theih matengun a pang khat le a pang langkhatah a tui kikhen hi.

en: Look to the LORD and His strength; seek His face always.
zo: Topa le ama hatna zong unla, ama ompihna zong den un!

en: For I have now chosen and consecrated this temple so that My Name may be there forever. My eyes and My heart will always be there.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh a tawntungin ka min a om theih nadingin keimah in hih biakinn teelin ka ap khin a, ka mit tawh enin ka lungsim a tawntungin tua lai-ah om ding hi.

en: While Ezra was praying and confessing, weeping and throwing himself down before the house of God, a very large crowd of Israelites—men, women, and children—gathered around him. They too wept bitterly.
zo: Ezra in tu-a bangin thu ngenin mawhna pulakin khitui naptui tawh Pasian’ biakinn mai-ah kunin a om laitakin Israel mi numei, pasal, naupang, mi tampi tak ama kiimah hong kikhawmin amaute khempeuh zong nakpitakin a kap uh hi.

en: The whole assembly that had returned from the exile made booths and lived in them. From the days of Joshua son of Nun until that day, the Israelites had not celebrated it with such great joy.
zo: Tua hi a, salsuahna panin a hong ciahkik a kikhawm mite khempeuh in sawlbuk lamin tuate sungah om uh hi; bang hang hiam cih leh Nun’ tapa Joshua’ hun a kipanin tua ni dongin Israel mite in tua bangin hih ngei lo uh hi. Tua hi a, amaute lungdam mahmah uh hi.

en: In every province and in every city to which the edict of the king came, there was joy and gladness among the Jews, with feasting and celebrating. And many people of other nationalities became Jews because fear of the Jews had seized them.
zo: Kumpipa’ thupiakna a tunna gam le khua khempeuhah Jew mite a dingin lungdamna le kipahna, pawi bawlna le nasep khawlin zum khakna a om hi. Tua hi a, midangte in Jew mite kihta uh ahih manin tua gam a om mi tampi tak in Jew mi ka hi uh hi, a ci uh hi.

en: Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job? There is no one on earth like him, a man of perfect integrity, who fears God and shuns evil.”
zo: Tua ciangin Topa in Satan kiangah, “Ka nasem Job na phawkkha hiam? A paubaang lo, a thutang, Pasian zahtakin gamtat hoih lo a peel amah tawh a kibang midang leitungah na mu kei ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: Surely goodness and mercy will follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the LORD forever.
zo: Na hoihna le nong itna in ka khantawnin a hong zuih ding tel takin-ah ka thei ta a, a tawntungin na inn sungah ka om ding hi.

en: How can a young man keep his way pure? By living according to Your word.
zo: Tangval khat in ama gamtatna a siangtho mahmah dingin bangci kep ding ahi hiam? Nangma thu zuihna tawh ama gamtatna siangthosak thei ding hi.

en: A false balance is an abomination to the LORD, but an accurate weight is His delight.
zo: Tawikhaina man lo a zangte Topa in mudah a, tawikhaina man a zangte tungah Topa lungkim hi.

en: He who conceals his sins does not prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy.
zo: A khialhna a im mite a dau pai lo ding a, a mawhna pulakin a kikheel mite in hehpihna ngah ding uh hi.

en: Yet when I surveyed all that my hands had done and what I had toiled to achieve, everything was meaningless, a chasing after the wind; there was nothing to be gained under the sun.
zo: Tua ciangin ka sepsa na khempeuh, tua bangin haksapi a ka sepnate ka ngaihsut kik ciangin, na khempeuh a mawknapi ahihna, le leitungah bangmah phattuamna a om lohna ka phawk hi.

en: “Woe to me!” I cried. “I am ruined! For I am a man of unclean lips, and I live among a people of unclean lips, and my eyes have seen the King, the LORD of Hosts.”
zo: Tua ciangin keimah in, “Gim ngah pa hi ta ing! Bang hang hiam cih leh a mawknapi ka hi hi; ka kama ka thugen khempeuh a mawkna vive hi a, a thugen khempeuh uh mawhna le nitna ahi mite lakah ka tengkha hi. Vanglian Topa , Kumpipa ka mukha khinta hi,” ka ci hi.

en: “Ah, Lord GOD,” I said, “I do not know how to speak, for I am only a child.”
zo: Tua ciangin keimah in, “Ah, Topa Pasian aw, kei thugen ka siam kei a, naupang khat ka hi lel hi,” ka ci hi.

en: “So I sought for a man among them who would build up the wall and stand in the gap before Me for the land, so that I would not have to destroy it. But I found no one.
zo: Keimah in ka hehna tawh ka suksiat ding hun ciangin kulh a ciangzo ding, kulh a kicipna munah a cingzo ding, le gam sung a huzo ding mi khat amaute lakah ka zong a, ahi zongin tua bang ding mi khat beek ka muzo kei hi.

en: The king said to Daniel, “Surely your God is the God of gods and the Lord of kings and a revealer of mysteries, for you were able to reveal this mystery.”
zo: Kumpipa in, “Hih thuthukpi hong genthei na hih manin na Pasian pen thuthuk a lak, pasian khempeuh sung pan a lianpen, kumpite’ tunga Topa ahi hi,” a ci hi.

en: How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I hand you over, Israel? How can I treat you like Admah? How can I make you like Zeboiim? My heart is changed within Me; all My compassion is aroused.
zo: Israel mite aw, bangci-a hong nusia thei ding a, bangci-a hong paidak thei ding ka hi hiam? Admah khua ka suksiat bangin kong susia nuam kei a, Zeboiim khua ka bawl bangin kong bawl nuam kei hi. Note hong khasiat mahmah ka hih manin tua banga hih ding ka lungsimah om lo hi.

en: Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
zo: A lungnem mite in Pasian’ ciamsa leitang ngah ding uh ahih manin thupha ngah mi ahi uh hi.

en: Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
zo: Hih naupangno khat’ man’ bangin Pasian’ Ukna a mang lo mi peuhmah Pasian’ Ukna sungah om lo ding ahihna thei un,” a ci hi.

en: Now there was a man in Jerusalem called Simeon, who was righteous and devout. He was waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
zo: Jerusalem khua sungah Simeon a kici mi khat na om hi. Amah a thuman, a biakna mi mahmah khat hi a, Israel mite a kihotkhiat hun ding a ngakngak mi khat ahi hi. Kha Siangtho in a ompih mi khat hi a,

en: Yet to all who received Him, to those who believed in His name, He gave the right to become children of God—
zo: Tua bang hitaseleh ama thu ngai-in amah a um mite khempeuh tungah Pasian’ tate suahtheih nading thu a pia hi.

en: As for us, we cannot help speaking about what we have seen and heard.”
zo: Tua ahih manin kote in ka muhsa uh le ka zaksa uh thute gen loin ka om thei kei ding uh hi,” ci-in a dawng uh hi.

en: Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, called to be an apostle, and set apart for the gospel of God,
zo: Pasian kiang panin a hong pai Lungdamna Thu a hilh dingin Pasian’ teelna tawh sawltak ahi, Jesuh Khrih’ sila keimah Paul in lai ka hong khak hi.

en: I appeal to you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another so that there may be no divisions among you and that you may be perfectly united in mind and thought.
zo: Sanggamte aw, note khatlekhat kithutuakin, pawl kikhenna omkha loin, na lungsim, na ngaihsutna uh le na ngimna uh na kikhatsak nadingun i Topa Jesuh Khrih min tawh ka hong thum hi.

en: All this is from God, who reconciled us to Himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation:
zo: Hih thu khempeuh Pasian’ vaihawm hi a, eite pen Pasian’ gal hinapi-in Khrih hangin amah tawh a kilem mi hong hisak a, kote tungah tua kilem nading nasep hong pia hi.

en: The acts of the flesh are obvious: sexual immorality, impurity, and debauchery;
zo: Tu-in mihing pianzia hong kitel a, tuate pen: Numei tawh mawhna, thangtatna, lanluat mana khialhna,

en: And in Him you too are being built together to become a dwelling in which God lives by His Spirit.
zo: Note zong midangte tawh kigawmin ama tungah na kilam uh a, Kha Siangtho-in Pasian a ten nading inn na suak uh hi.

en: then make my joy complete by being like-minded, having the same love, being one in spirit and purpose.
zo: Tua ahih manin kei tawh ngaihsutna kibangin note khatlekhat ki-itin, khatlekhat lungsim kituakin na omna uh tawh keima lungdamna na hong cingtaaksak nadingun ka hong kun hi.

en: Therefore, as God’s chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience.
zo: Pasian in note hong itin, hong teelin, ama mi siangthote hikhin na hih manun note pen hehpihna nei-in, migi-in, kiniamkhiatin, dikin, na lungduai ding uh ahi hi.

en: We continually remember before our God and Father your work produced by faith, your labor prompted by love, and your endurance inspired by hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh i Pa Pasian kiangah thu ka nget simun note’ upna hangin na nuntakziate uh, itna na neih manun nakpitakin na nasepnate uh le i Topa Jesuh Khrih hong paikik ding lametna na neih manun kiptakin na omnate uh ka phawk tawntung uh hi.

en: We ought always to thank God for you, brothers, and rightly so, because your faith is growing more and more, and the love every one of you has for each other is increasing.
zo: Sanggamte aw, note’ upna nakpitakin khang a, note khatlekhat na ki-itna uh lian semsem ahih manin Pasian tungah lungdamna koh ding a kilawm ahih mah bangin, note hangin ama tungah lungdamna ka ko tawntung uh hi.

en: Command them to do good, to be rich in good deeds, and to be generous and willing to share.
zo: A hoih nate semin, gamtat pha-in, citna lungsim nei-in midangte a hopnop nadingun na hilh in.

en: Flee the evil desires of youth and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace, along with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
zo: Tua ahih manin khangno lunggulhna hoih lote pelh inla, lungsim takpi tawh Topa tungah huhna a ngen mite tawh thuman thutak, upna, itna, kilemna na neihtheih nadingun hanciam khawm un.

en: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh mi khempeuh in hotkhiatna a ngahtheih nadingun Pasian in ama hehpihna hong lak khinzo hi.

en: Through Jesus, therefore, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise—the fruit of lips that confess His name.
zo: Tua ahih manin Jesuh tungtawnin amah i biakna-in i kam tawh ama min pulakin Pasian phat tawntung ni.

en: Therefore, get rid of all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent, and humbly accept the word planted in you, which can save you.
zo: Tua ahih manin ngeina hoih lote le gamtat siate khempeuh nusia unla, Pasian’ thu mangin note’ lungsim sungah a hong koih thu zui un. Tua thu in note hong honkhia thei hi.

en: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
zo: Note zong nuntakna a piathei suangpi mah bangin kha thu tawh kisai biakinn lam nadingin na kizang unla, Jesuh Khrih hangin Pasian’ santheih biaknate a pia dingin a siangtho siampi na suak un.

en: Through these He has given us His precious and magnificent promises, so that through them you may become partakers of the divine nature, now that you have escaped the corruption in the world caused by evil desires.
zo: Amah in piak dingin a hong ciam a manpha mahmah nate hih bangzia-in hong pia a, hih ama hong piak nate hangin leitungah a om siatna a piangsak thei duhluatna le deihluatnate panin na suakta uh a, Pasian’ pianziate na nei uh hi.

en: for everyone born of God overcomes the world. This is the victory that has overcome the world, even our faith.
zo: Pasian’ ta ahite peuhmah in leitung nate zo uh a, i upna tawh leitung nate tungah a gualzo ihi hi.

en: I, John, your brother and companion in the suffering and kingdom and patient endurance that are ours in Jesus, was on the island of Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.
zo: Note’ sanggam keimah Johan in Jesuh tawh kipawlna hangin note mah bangin bawlsiatna thuakin, Pasian’ Ukna sungah omin, lungduai takin a thuak mipa ka hi hi. Pasian’ thu le Jesuh’ hong gen thumante ka genna hangin Patmos a kici tuikulh-ah kei hong kikoih hi.

en: Let him who does wrong continue to do wrong; let him who is vile continue to be vile; let him who does right continue to do right; and let him who is holy continue to be holy.”
zo: A gilo mite gilo lailai hen la, a kihhuai gamtatte kihhuai gamtat lailai hen la, a hoih gamtatte hoih gamtat lailai hen la, a siangtho mite a siangtho mah hi lailai ta hen!” hong ci hi.

en: Behold, I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go, and I will bring you back to this land. For I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
zo: En in, keimah in nang hong ompihin na paina peuhah kong kem ding a, hih leitangah nang kong paipih kik ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh nang’ tunga kong gensa thute ka hih khit matengin nang kong nusia kei ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: The LORD would speak to Moses face to face, as a man speaks with his friend. Then Moses would return to the camp, but his young assistant Joshua son of Nun did not leave the tent.
zo: Tua bangin, mi khat in a lawmpa a hopih bangin maitang kituahin Topa in Moses hopih zel hi. Giahphual ah Moses a ciahkik ciangin, Nun’ tapa, ama nasem tangval Joshua, puanbukah omlai hi.

en: Show me Your ways, O LORD, teach me Your paths.
zo: Topa aw, na zia na tong a thei-in hong bawl inla, na lampite hong hilh in.

en: Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
zo: Kisaktheihna in siatna hong tuaksak a, kiphatsakna in pukna hong piangsak hi.

en: When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.
zo: Tuite na kantan ciangin nang kong ompih ding a, gunte na kantan ciangin tui in hong tuum lo ding hi. Mei kantanin na pai ciangin na kang kei ding a, meikuangte in nang hong kangtum lo ding hi.

en: But blessed is the man who trusts in the LORD, whose confidence is in Him.
zo: “ Topa muangin amah a beel mi in thupha a ngah ahi hi.

en: “Do not judge, or you too will be judged.
zo: “Pasian in note hong mawhsak loh nadingin midangte va mawhsaksak nawn kei un.

en: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
zo: Tua ahih manin na Pa un hehpihna a neih bangin note in zong hehpihna lungsim nei ta un.

en: I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master’s business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from My Father I have made known to you.
zo: Nasemte in a tote’ nasepna bangmah thei lo ahih manin note pen nasemte ka hong ci nawn kei ding hi. Ka Pa’ tung panin ka zak thu khempeuh note kiangah hong genkhin ka hih manin note, lawm, ka hong ci zaw ding hi.

en: And they prayed, “Lord, You know everyone’s heart. Show us which of these two You have chosen
zo: Tua ciangin amaute in thu ngen uh a, “Mihing khempeuh’ lungsim sung thu a thei Topa aw, ama om nadingin a kilawm munah a om dingin sawltak nasep panin a hong paisan Judas tang dingin, hih mi nih sung panin na teel penpen hong hilh in,” a ci uh hi.

en: Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction, faithful in prayer.
zo: Lamet na neihna hangun lungdamin om tawntung unla, lungkhamna na thuak uh ciangin lungduai-in thu na ngen tawntung un.

en: For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
zo: Bang hang hiam cih leh sihna a thuak mite a dingin singlamteh tungah Khrih sihna thu pen a haihuai thu ahi hi. Ahi zongin hotkhiatna a ngah eite a dingin Pasian’ vangliatna ahi hi.

en: From now on, let no one cause me trouble, for I bear on my body the marks of Jesus.
zo: A tawpna-ah ka gennop thu in: Ka pum tunga om meimapawn pen Khrih sila ka hihna lim ahih manin kuamah in kei hong nawngkaisak nawn kei tahen.

en: Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice.
zo: Kimuhdahna, hehna, thangpaihna, kitotna, kikona, kilungsim neihna khempeuh beisak unla,

en: Whatever you have learned or received or heard from me, or seen in me—put it into practice. And the God of peace will be with you.
zo: Keima genna le ka gamtatna panin thei-in na san uh thute, nomau pumpi mahmah tawh na zui un. Tua hileh nopsakna a hong piathei Pasian in note hong ompih ding hi.

en: Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives’ tales; rather, train yourself to be godly.
zo: Pasian’ thu tawh a kituak lo, a haihuai tangthu phuahtawmte ngaihsutin na nei vet kei in. Pasian’ deihna tawh a kituakin na nuntak zawh nadingin na kisin in.

en: God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope offered to us may be greatly encouraged.
zo: Tua hi a, a kikheel thei lo thu nih kithuap ahih manin Pasian in zuau gen thei lo ding hi. Tua hi a, amah a beel eite in eite mai-ah hong kikoih lametna thu kiptakin i letcip nadingin i tha hong nuamsak hi.

en: When tempted, no one should say, “God is tempting me.” For God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does He tempt anyone;
zo: Mi khat peuhpeuh in tua bang ze-etna a thuak ciangin, “Pasian in kei hong ze-et hi,” ci-in ngaihsun kei hen. Siatna in Pasian ze-et ngei lo a, mite a siat nadingin Pasian in zong ze-et ngei lo hi.

en: But even if you should suffer for what is right, you are blessed. “Do not fear what they fear; do not be frightened.”
zo: A hoihin na gamtat manun gimna na thuak uhleh zong Pasian in thupha hong pia ding hi. Mite kihta kei unla, lunghihmawh ngaihsut kei un.

en: He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To him who overcomes, I will give some of the hidden manna. I will also give him a white stone with a new name written on it, known only to him who receives it.
zo: Tua ahih manin zak nading bil a neite in Kha Siangtho in pawlpite kiangah a gen thute na za un. A gualzo mi tungah a kiselcip manna an pawlkhat le min thak a kigelhna suangkang khat ka pia ding hi. Tua suangkang pen a ngahte simloh kuamah dang in thei lo ding hi.

en: He who testifies to these things says, “Yes, I am coming soon.” Amen. Come, Lord Jesus!
zo: Hih thu khempeuh hong genin teci a pang mipa in, “Ka hong pai baih taktak ding hi,” hong ci hi. Na cih bangin hi ta peuh hen. Topa Jesuh aw, hong pai ta in!

en: Then Joseph remembered his dreams about them and said to them, “You are spies! You have come to see where our land is unprotected.”
zo: Josef in a mangin amaute a mat khitna a phawk hi. Amah in amaute kiangah, “Note, thukan na hi uh a, hih gam thaneemna a en dingin hong pai na hi uh hi,” a ci hi.

en: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
zo: mit tang ding mit, ha tang ding ha, khut tang ding khut, khe tang ding khe,

en: The goat will carry on itself all their iniquities to a solitary place, and the man shall release it in the wilderness.
zo: Keel in amau’ mawhnate khempeuh pua-in gam daihna-ah a pai dingin a keel khah ding hi.

en: But Balaam said to Balak, “See, I have come to you. But can I say just anything? I must speak only the word that God puts in my mouth.”
zo: Balaam in Balak kiangah, “En in, na kiang hong tung ing! Thu khatpeuh ka gen theih nading vangliatna nei ka hi hiam? Pasian in hong sawl thu bek ka gen ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: It is to be with him, and he is to read it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to revere the LORD his God and follow carefully all the words of this law and these decrees
zo: Hih thukham sunga thute le hih ngeinate kemin zuihna tawh Topa a Pasian zahtak ding a theih nading, a mipihte tungah ama lungsim a kiliatsak loh nading, thupiaknate them khat zong a pelh loh nading, le Israel-te sung ahi ama kumpi gam sungah amah le a tate saupi a om theih nadingin amah in a nuntak sung tawntung tua sunga thute sim ding hi.

en: Then Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two spies from Shittim. “Go, look over the land,” he said, “especially Jericho.” So they went and entered the house of a prostitute named Rahab and stayed there.
zo: Tua ciangin Nun’ tapa Joshua in Shittim panin thukanin mi nih sawlsim a, “Pai-in gam va en unla, a diakdiakin Jerikho khua hong en un,” a ci hi. Amaute pai uh a, Rahab min nei a paktat numei khat’ inn-ah tungin giak uh hi.

en: “I will certainly go with you,” said Deborah. “But because of the way you are going about this, the honor will not be yours, for the LORD will deliver Sisera into the hands of a woman.”
zo: Tua ciangin amah in, “Nang tawh kong kuan taktak ding hi. Ahi zongin gualzawhna pen nangma min than nading hi lo ding hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa in numei khat’ khut sungah Sisera pia ding hi,” a ci hi. Tua ciangin Deborah dingin Barak tawh Kedesh-ah pai hi.

en: Samuel said to Saul, “Why have you disturbed me by bringing me up?” “I am in great distress,” Saul said. “The Philistines are fighting against me, and God has turned away from me. He no longer answers me, either by prophets or by dreams. So I have called on you to tell me what to do.”
zo: Tua ciangin Samuel in Saul kiangah, “Bang hangin keimah saptohna tawh hong nawngkaisak na hi hiam?” a ci hi. Saul in dawngin, “Nakpi takin ka lungkham hi; Filistia-te in kei hong sim a, kei kiang panin Pasian kiheikhia-in kamsangte tawh ahi a, mang tawh ahi zongin hong dawng nawn lo hi. Tua ahih ciangin ka gamtat nading zia a hong gen dingin nang kong sam hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then Nathan said to David, “You are the man! This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I anointed you king over Israel, and I delivered you from the hand of Saul.
zo: Tua ciangin Nathan in David kiangah, “Nang pen tua mipa na hi hi. Israel Pasian, Topa in hih bangin ci hi: ‘Israel-te tungah kumpi-in nang sathau hong nilhin Saul’ khutsung panin nang kong honkhia hi.

en: When King Jeroboam heard the word that the man of God cried out against the altar at Bethel, he stretched out his hand from the altar and said, “Seize him!” But the hand he stretched out toward the man shriveled up, so that he could not pull it back.
zo: Bethel-a biakna tau langpangin Pasian’ mipa’ thugenna kumpipa in a zak ciangin biakna tau panin Jeroboam in a khut zan a, “Amah lencip un,” a ci hi. Tua ciangin amah langpangin a zankhiat a khut keucip ahih manin a khut tonsakkik thei nawn lo hi.

en: In those days Hezekiah became ill and was at the point of death. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz went to him and said, “This is what the LORD says: Put your house in order, because you are going to die; you will not recover.”
zo: Tua hun laitakin Hezekiah cina-in si dektak hi. Tua ciangin Amoz’ tapa kamsang Isaiah hong pai-in ama kiangah, “ Topa in hih bangin ci hi: ‘Na innkuan vai ding hawm in; bang hang hiam cih leh nang na si ding hi; na damkikzo kei ding hi,’ ci hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
zo: Satan in Israel mite gimsak nuam ahih manin Israel mi phazah a sim dingin David hanthawn hi.

en: But when envoys were sent by the rulers of Babylon to ask him about the miraculous sign that had occurred in the land, God left him to test him and to know everything that was in his heart.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin gam sung omzia lim a kan dingin ama kiangah a kisawl Babylon uliante’ kamtaite tawh kisai-in, amah a ze-etna ding le ama lungsim sungah bang om hiam cih a vekpi-in a theih nadingin Pasian in ama thu-in amah a omsak hi.

en: And you, Ezra, in accordance with the wisdom of your God, which you possess, are to appoint magistrates and judges to administer justice for all the people of Trans-Euphrates—all who know the laws of your God. And you are to teach any who do not know them.
zo: “Tua hi a, nang Ezra in nang tungah hong kipia na Pasian’ pilna tawh kizui-in Eufratis Gungal gam sunga mite thu a khen dingin na Pasian’ thukham a thei mite seh in. Nang le amaute in na Pasian’ thukham a thei lote na hilh ding uh hi.

en: When I heard these things, I sat down and wept. For some days I mourned and fasted and prayed before the God of heaven.
zo: Hih thu ka zak ciangin tusukin ka kap niloh a, ni tampi sung an tangin, vantung Pasian kiangah thu ka ngen hi.

en: When Mordecai learned of all that had been done, he tore his clothes, put on sackcloth and ashes, and went out into the city, wailing loudly and bitterly.
zo: Mordekai in hih thupiang teng a theih ciangin a puan balkekin puanhampi silhin vut kibuak a, nakpitakin a kap kawmin khua sungah vak kawikawi hi.

en: So Satan went out from the presence of the LORD and afflicted Job with painful sores from the soles of his feet to the crown of his head.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin Topa’ omna panin Satan paikhia a, Job a khetul pan a luzang dongin a kihhuai meima a veisak hi.

en: In peace I will lie down and sleep, for You alone, O LORD, make me dwell in safety.
zo: Nuamtakin lumin ka ihmu ta ding hi; bang hang hiam cih leh Topa aw, nangmah bek in lungmuanna munah na hong omsak hi.

en: He split the rocks in the wilderness and gave them water as abundant as the seas;
zo: Amah in gam sungah suangpite kitamsak a, tuithukpi sung panin a piangkhia bangin amaute’ tungah tui dawn ding tampi a pia hi.

en: “The LORD possessed me at the beginning of His work, before His deeds of old.
zo: “ Topa in kei hong piangsak masa pen a, tangtawnga ama sep lak pan a masa pen ka hi hi.

en: If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat; if he is thirsty, give him water to drink.
zo: Na galte a gil a kial leh an pia inla, a dang a tak leh tui pia in.

en: A good name is better than fine perfume, and the day of death better than the day of birth.
zo: A manpha paknamtui sangin minpha hoihzaw a, i suah ni sangin i sih ni hoihzaw hi.

en: Learn to do right; seek justice. Defend the oppressed. Take up the cause of the fatherless; plead the case of the widow.
zo: Gamtat hoih ding kisin un. Thumanin gamta unla, kinetniamna kheel un. Pa nei lote hu unla, meigong numei panpih un,” ci hi.

en: This is what the LORD says: “A voice is heard in Ramah, mourning and great weeping, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.”
zo: Topa in kong cihin-ah: “Ramah khua-ah aw khat kiza a, tauna le kah ngutngutna awging ahi hi. Rachel, a tate a dingin a kap hi. A tate om nawn lo ahih manin kinem zo lo hi,” a ci hi.

en: And I went to the exiles at Tel-abib who lived by the Kebar River. And there, where they were living, I sat among them for seven days, overwhelmed.
zo: Tua ahih manin ka mipih salte’ omna, Khebar Gun gei-a a om Telabib munah ka va tung a, ka muhsa thute ngaihsunin tua lai-a amaute lakah ni sagih sung ka om hi.

en: Suddenly the fingers of a human hand appeared and wrote on the plaster of the wall, near the lampstand in the royal palace. The king watched the hand as it wrote.
zo: Thakhat thu-in kumpi innsung meivak a taan penna lam kawm tungah mihing khut khat hong kilangin lai a hong gelh hi. Tua khut in lai a gelh laitak kumpipa in a mu hi.

en: When they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. “Get up,” he said, “take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to search for the child to kill him.”
zo: Tua mipilte a ciah khit uh ciangin Josef’ mang sungah Topa’ vantungmi khat hong kilang a, “Kithawi-in naungek le a nu, Egypt gamah taipih in. Pai khia un, ci-in kong genkik matengin tua gamah va om un. Herod in naungek thah dingin hong zong ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” “My name is Legion,” he replied, “for we are many.”
zo: Jesuh in, “Na min bang ahi hiam?” ci-in a dong hi. Mipa in, “Kote tampi pha ka hih manun ka min pen A Honpi ahi hi,” ci-in a dawng hi.

en: But a Samaritan, as he traveled, came where the man was; and when he saw him, he took pity on him.
zo: Ahi zongin Samaria mi khualzin khat, tua lai mun hong tungin a liam pa a muh ciangin hehpihhuaisa a,

en: “Nazareth! Can anything good come from there?” Nathanael asked. “Come and see,” said Philip.
zo: Nethanel in, “Nazareth khua panin bang hong piang peuhmah ding ahi hiam?” na cihsan hi. Ahi zongin Filip in, “Hong pai inla, hong mu dih in,” a ci hi.

en: When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.
zo: Pentekos ni hong tun ciangin Jesuh a um mi khempeuh mun khatah kikhawm uh hi.

en: The wrath of God is being revealed from heaven against all the godlessness and wickedness of men who suppress the truth by their wickedness,
zo: Mihingte in a mawhna le a gitlohna hangun Pasian’ thuman seelcip uh ahih manin van panin a hehna hong kilang sakin a gimpiakna dingzia hong kilangsak hi.

en: What I mean is this: One of you says, “I follow Paul”; another, “I follow Apollos”; another, “I follow Cephas”; still another, “I follow Christ.”
zo: Tua bang ka cih ciangin note pawlkhat in, “Kei, Paul’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi a, pawlkhat in, “Kei, Apollos’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi a, pawlkhat in, “Kei, Peter’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi a, pawlkhat in, “Kei, Khrih’ pawl ka hi hi,” cihna ahi zongin na kampaunate uh ka cihna ahi hi.

en: And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light.
zo: Tua pen lamdangsak ding hi lo hi. Satan nangawn Pasian’ vantungmi tawh a kibangin kibawltawm thei hi.

en: When Peter came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he was clearly in the wrong.
zo: Antiok khua-ah Peter hong hawh sungin a gamtat khialhna hangin thu uppih mite lak mahah amah ka taii hi.

en: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which He has called you, the riches of His glorious inheritance in the saints,
zo: Note bang dingin hong sam a, a mite tungah a hong ciam thupha lamdangte bangzah takin lian a, thu um ahi eite sungah na a hong sem vangliatna bangzah takin lian ahi hiam, cih na muhtheih nadingun note’ lungsim mit hong vaksak nadingin thu ka na ngen hi. Eite sungah na a hong sem vangliatna pen sihna panin Khrih hingsakin, vantung gamah zong, ama taklamah a tutsak nadingin a zat vangliatna mah ahi hi.

en: And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
zo: Mihingte in a theihtel zawh loh Pasian’ hong piak lungsim nopna in, Khrih Jesuh tawh na kipawlna uh hangin note hong lungnuamsak ding hi.

en: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation.
zo: Khrih pen a kimu thei lo Pasian’ lim hi a, a kipiangsak khempeuh lakah tapa upa pen ahi hi.

en: Brothers, we do not want you to be ignorant about those who fall asleep, or to grieve like the rest of men, who have no hope.
zo: Sanggamte aw, lametna a nei lo mite bangin na dahluat loh nadingun a sisa mite’ omzia ding thu na theih ding uh ka deih hi.

en: We hear that some among you are idle. They are not busy; they are busybodies.
zo: Hih bangin thu ka hong genna uh pen note lakah mi pawlkhatte thadahin na sem nuam lo uh a, midangte’ nasepna va nawngkaisak zawsop hi, ci-in ka zakna hang uh ahi hi.

en: He must not be a recent convert, or he may become conceited and fall under the same judgment as the devil.
zo: Khristian a suaktungte zong hi lo ding hi. Tua bang mi thakte kiphasak thei a, Dawimangpa mah bangin thukhenna a thuak mite hikha thei ding hi.

en: Nevertheless, God’s solid foundation stands firm, sealed with this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are His,” and, “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.”
zo: Ahi zongin Pasian in a phuhsa sutpi kilokzo ngei lo ding hi. Tua sutpi tungah, “Topa in ama mi kua teng hiam cih thei hi,” cihna le, “Topa tawh kipawl ing, a ci peuhmah in mawhna sukhalo ding hi,” cihna kigelh hi.

en: Warn a divisive person once, and then warn him a second time. After that, have nothing to do with him.
zo: Kitot, kikhen nading a piangsak mite pen khatvei nihvei bang na hilh khit ciangin kisukha nawn vet kei in.

en: Therefore, since the promise of entering His rest still stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.
zo: Ahi zongin tu-in eite va pai-in amah tawh i tawlngak khawm theih nadingin Pasian in thuciam hong nusiat khin ahih manin tua tawlngakna munah a lutlah na suahkhak loh nadingun lau-in kidawm ni.

en: My brothers, as believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ, do not show favoritism.
zo: Sanggamte aw, minthanna vang tawh a kidim i Topa Jesuh Khrih umin na om laitakun a pualama kilang pianziate siksanin mi na deidan kei un.

en: For you know that it was not with perishable things such as silver or gold that you were redeemed from the empty way of life you inherited from your forefathers,
zo: Na pu na pate uh nuntakzia, bangmahin a kimang lo nuntakna panin a hong suahtaksak nadingin Pasian in note’ man dingin a piak pen a man a kiam thei ngun le khamte bang hi lo a,

en: He writes this way in all his letters, speaking in them of these matters. Some of his comments are hard to understand, which ignorant and unstable people distort, as they do the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.
zo: Lai a hong gelhna sungah a thugente tu-ate mah a gennuam ahi hi. A laigelhna sungah a telhak thu tampi om a, theihna kicing loin lungsim kip lo mi pawlkhatte in Lai Siangtho sung thu a ututun a kawihei uh bangin Paul’ thugente zong a man lopi-in khia uh ahih manin siatna a tuaklawh uh hi.

en: If anyone has material possessions and sees his brother in need but has no pity on him, how can the love of God be in him?
zo: Mi khat hau mahmah hen la, a Khristian mipih a cimawhte mu napi-in huhna bangmah pianuam hetkei leh, bang hangin amah in Pasian ka it hi, ci thei ding ahi hiam?

en: I looked, and there before me was a pale horse! Its rider was named Death, and Hades was following close behind him. They were given power over a fourth of the earth to kill by sword, famine, and plague, and by the wild beasts of the earth.
zo: Ka khuadak leh sakol puang khat ka mu a, a tungah a tuang pa’ min pen Sihna hi a, a nungah Hell in a zui hi. Amaute in namsau, kialpi, pulnatna, le gamsate tawh leitung mi sehlisuah sehkhat a thahtheih nadingun thu a kipia hi.

en: And he cried out in a mighty voice: “Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great! She has become a dwelling for demons and a haunt for every unclean spirit, a haunt for every unclean and detestable bird.
zo: Amah nakpitakin kiko a, “A Lian Babylon khuapi kicim, kicim! Tu-in dawite’ kua suak khinta-in, kha gilote’ omna suak khinta a, a kihhuai, a muhdahhuai vasa namkim in omna-in neita uh hi.

en: That is why it was called Babel, because there the LORD confused the language of the whole world. From there the LORD scattered them over the face of the whole earth.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin a min Babel kici hi. Bang hang hiam cih leh Topa in tua munah leitung khempeuh’ kampau kitukalhsak hi. Tua lai mun panin Topa in leitung khempeuhah amaute a thehthang hi.

en: “Who among the gods is like You, O LORD? Who is like You—majestic in holiness, awesome in glory, working wonders?
zo: “ Topa aw, pasian-te’ lakah kua, nang tawh kibang ahi hiam? Kua, nang tawh kibangin, sianthona-ah lianin, minthang nasepna-ah kihtakhuai-in, nalamdang sem ahi hiam?

en: The steps of a good man are ordered by the LORD, and He delights in his way.
zo: Topa in mi a lam pai nading lak a, ama lungkim bangin a gamta pa amah in a kipsak hi.

en: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who wins souls is wise.
zo: Midikte a khansau a, migilote khansih hi.

en: I have swept away your transgressions like a cloud, your sins like the morning mist. Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.”
zo: Na thupalsatnate meiipi bangin na khialhnate meiilum bangin ka phiatkhia khinzo hi. Hong honkhia khin ka hih manin kei kiangah hong ciahkik in.

en: “Behold, the days are coming,” declares the LORD, “when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and He will reign as King and act wisely and administer justice and righteousness in the land.
zo: “En un, Topa in kong cihin-ah, keimah in David’ suan lak panin kumpi dingin a diktat mi khat ka khankhiatsak ni hong tung ding hi. Amah gam uk siam mahmah ding a, gam sungah thuman thutang tawh thu hong khen ding hi.

en: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field. When a man found it, he hid it again, and in his joy he went and sold all he had and bought that field.
zo: “Vantung ki-ukna pen lolai-ah a kiseel sum tawh kibang hi. Mi khat in a muh ciangin limtakin a seelpha hi. Amah lungdam mahmahin a inn-ah ciahpah a, a neih khempeuh a zuak khit ciangin tua lo a lei hi.

en: Jesus called out with a loud voice, “Father, into Your hands I commit My spirit.” And when He had said this, He breathed His last.
zo: Tua ciangin nakpitakin Jesuh kiko a, “Pa aw, nangma khut sungah keimah kong ki-ap hi,” a cih khit ciangin a si ta hi.

en: Jesus replied, “Truly, truly, I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God unless he is born again.”
zo: Jesuh in, “A mantakin kong genin-ah, mi khatpeuh a suahkik kei leh Pasian’ Ukna sungah lut thei lo ding hi,” a ci hi.

en: And He is not served by human hands, as if He needed anything, because He Himself gives all men life and breath and everything else.
zo: Amah pen mi khempeuh tungah nuntakna le na khempeuh a piapa ahih manin mihingte in ama a dingin na khat peuhpeuh a sepsak ding a kisam ahi kei hi.

en: No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us.
zo: Eite a hong it pa’ hangin hih thu khempeuhah a gualzo pente ihi hi.

en: “Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?”
zo: Sihna aw, na gualzawhna koi-ah om a, midangte na suksiat zawh nading na thahatna koi-ah omta ahi hiam?” na ci hi.

en: If you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.
zo: Khrih tawh na kipawl nak-uhleh Abraham’ suante na hita uh a, Pasian’ hong khap thute a ngah ding na hi uh hi.

en: As for you, you were dead in your transgressions and sins,
zo: A beisa hunah na thuman lohna uh le na mawhna uh hangin kha thu tawh kisai-ah a si na hi uh hi.

en: And being found in appearance as a man, He humbled Himself and became obedient to death—even death on a cross!
zo: Amah hong kiniamkhiat tawm a, singlamteh tung nangawnah sih ding a ut hi.

en: But now He has reconciled you by Christ’s physical body through death to present you holy, unblemished, and blameless in His presence—
zo: Ahi zongin, a Tapa a pumpi mahmahin a hong sihna hangin note, a cidam, a siangtho, paubaanna om hetloin ama kiangah hong laktheih nadingin Pasian in note ama lawmin a hong bawl khinta ahi hi.

en: who gave Himself as a ransom for all—the testimony given in its proper time.
zo: Mi khempeuh a tankhia dingin tua Jesuh hong kipiatawm a, a hun lian laitakin a hong kipiakna pen Pasian in mi khempeuh a hotkhiat nopna thu a kilatna ahi hi.

en: so also Christ was offered once to bear the sins of many; and He will appear a second time, not to bear sin, but to bring salvation to those who are eagerly waiting for Him.
zo: mi tampite’ mawhna a thuak dingin Khrih zong khatvei bek a kipia hi. A nihveina hong kilatkik ciangin mawhna thu tawh kisai nasem ding hi nawn loin, lawptakin amah a ngak mite a honkhia ding ahi hi.

en: In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead.
zo: Tua ahih ciangin gamtatna in a zui lo upna guak pen a si ahi hi.

en: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! By His great mercy He has given us new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
zo: I Topa Jesuh Khrih’ Pa Pasian tungah lungdam ni. Ama hong hehpih mahmahna hangin sihna panin Jesuh Khrih a thawhkik sakna tawh eite tungah nuntakna thak a hong pia hi. Tua ahih manin i lametna kiam ngei lo a,

en: All inhabitants of the earth will worship the beast—all whose names have not been written in the book of life belonging to the Lamb that was slain from the foundation of the world.
zo: Tua ahih manin a kigo Tuuno laibu sungah a nungta ding mite’ min, leitung pianma pekin a kikhumna-ah a kihel lo leitung mi khempeuh in tua ganhing bia ding uh hi.

en: I did not see a temple in the city, because the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.
zo: A Vanglian Topa Pasian le Tuuno pen khuapi biakinn hita ahih manin tua khua sungah biakinn dang ka mu kei hi.

en: then the LORD your God will restore your fortunes and have compassion on you and gather you again from all the nations where He has scattered you.
zo: Topa na Pasian un note na ngei uh hong bangsakkikin, note tungah hehpihna hong nei ding a, Topa na Pasian un note hong thehthangna mi khempeuhte lak panin note hong kaikhawm kik ding hi.

en: In those days Israel had no king; everyone did what was right in his own eyes.
zo: Tua hun lai-in Israel-te sungah kumpi om lo a, amau’ hoihsak bang ciatin mi khempeuh a gamta uh hi.

en: Your house and your kingdom will endure forever before Me; your throne will be established forever.’”
zo: Na suanlekhakte le na kumpi gam keima mai-ah a kip tawntungin kibawl ding a, na kumpi tokhom kip tawntung ding hi,’ ci-in gen in,” a ci hi.

en: After the earthquake there was a fire, but the LORD was not in the fire. And after the fire came a gentle whisper.
zo: Zinling khit ciangin meikuang om a, ahih hangin meikuang sungah zong Topa om lo hi. Meikuang khit ciangin aw nem neu khat a ging hi.

en: He said, “Listen, all you people of Judah and Jerusalem! Listen, King Jehoshaphat! This is what the LORD says to you: ‘Do not be afraid or discouraged because of this vast army. For the battle is not yours, but God’s.
zo: Tua ciangin amah in, “Judah gam khempeuh le Jerusalem-a teng khempeuh, le Kumpi Jehoshafat aw, ngai un. Topa in hih bangin note’ tungah hong gen hi: ‘Kihta kei unla, hih a tam mi honpi hangin lungkia kei un; bang hang hiam cih leh galdona pen note a’ hi loin Pasian-a’ ahi hi.

en: “Go and enjoy choice food and sweet drinks,” he said. “And send some to those who have nothing prepared. For this day is holy to our Lord. Do not grieve, for the joy of the LORD is your strength.”
